num sampling and testing by the department before installation the project manager will select two num bolt nut and hardened washer assemblies from each rotational capacity lot and at least three num directtension indicators with accompanying bolts nuts and hardened washers for each diameter and grade of fastener for testing by the state materials bureau .
num shipping ship bolts nuts and washers from each rotational capacity lot in the same container .
if there is only one num production lot number for each size of nut washer and direct tension indicator the contractor may ship the nuts washers and direct tension indicators in separate containers .
permanently mark each container with the rotational capacity lot number .
num construction requirements the contractor shall fabricate materials it shall connect with highstrength bolts in accordance with section num steel structures .
blast clean steel faying surfaces in accordance with sspcsp num .
ensure that the bolted part surfaces adjacent to the bolt head and nut are parallel within the num degrees for parallel surface rolled steel members .
use beveled washers on surfaces with more than a num slope for proper seating .
use bolted parts that fit solidly together when assembled .
do not use gaskets or other flexible material .
erect joints and splices with cylindrical erection pins and bolts in accordance with section num steel structures .
use highstrength bolts instead of erection bolts if necessary .
these can be left in place provided they are not loosened and retightened .
num installation of bolts ensure that bolt nut and washer combinations are from the same rotational capacity lot .
section num highstrength bolts page num num lubrication ensure that black bolts are oily to the touch when delivered and installed .
clean and relubricate weathered or rusted bolts and nuts before installation .
retest recleaned or relubricated bolt nut and washer assemblies .
before installing galvanized nuts inspect the nuts to ensure the threads are properly lubricated .
if lubricant is not visible or if tensioning indicates that thread friction is too high apply an approved lubricant to the remaining threads before installation .
num method of installation install bolts in accordance with figure num installation details .
in general use method i .
use method num and method num as approved by the department where bolt entry wrench clearances or inspection procedures make method i impossible .
prevent the stationary element from turning .
for oversized or slotted holes place additional hardened washers between the bolted material and the fastener .
wherever practical place the nut where it is not visible from the traveled way .
when one end of a bolted assembly is embedded in concrete place the assembly so the nut end is in the concrete .
when tightening connections involving several bolts draw together plies of the steel by snugging the bolts before starting the tightening operations .
on connections involving a large number of bolts or thick materials tighten the bolts to the point where the directtension indicators are partially compressed .
in some cases proper tensioning of the bolts may require more than a single cycle of systematic partial tightening before final tightening to deform the directtension indicators to the specified gap .
ensure that the final gap between the bolt head and the directtension indicator is less than or equal to num in for method i and less than or equal to num in for method num or method num .
section num highstrength bolts page num figure num installation details ensure that galvanized bolt assembly direct tension indicator gap for all three num methods is less than or equal to num inch .
use method num or method num for galvanized bolt assemblies only after receiving department approval .
num inspection the department will visually inspect every bolt for gaps .
the department will also check at least ten percent num of the bolts but not less than two num bolts in each connection using feeler gauges as described in the direct tension indicator manufacturers instructions and in astm f num .
if the inspections indicate improper installation the project manager may reject the assemblies .
num method of measurementreserved num basis of payment the department will pay for high strength bolts as a part of structural steel tonnage in accordance with section num steel structures .
section num metal railing page num section num metal railing num description this work consists of providing and placing metal railing .
num materials num steel railings unless otherwise shown in the contract provide railing in accordance with astm a num or aashto m num grade num .
provide square or rectangular tube steel in accordance with astm a num grade b or astm a num .
provide black seamless steel pipe in accordance with astm a num .
hydrostatic testing is not required .
num bolts num anchor bolts provide anchor bolts in accordance with aashto m num astm a num astm a num astm f num or fabricate alternatively from aisi cnum or aisi cnum steel bar .
hot dip galvanized anchor bolts in accordance with aashto m num or mechanically galvanize in accordance with aashto m num class num .
provide heavy hex nuts in accordance with astm a num grade dh .
provide washers in accordance with astm f num .
num connection bolts .
provide connection bolts in accordance with astm a num grade a connection nuts in accordance with astm a num grade a connection washers in accordance with astm f num unless otherwise noted on the plans or standard drawings .
ensure that bolt dimensions are in accordance with ansi b num and nut dimensions are in accordance with ansi b num .
ensure washer dimensions and tolerances are in accordance with section num .
num caulking compound use a caulking that is a single component cold applied nonsagging compound with a silicone or a synthetic chemically curing type rubber base in accordance with federal specifications ttsnum a or ttsnum c. num construction requirements fabricate weld and erect railing in accordance with section num steel structures .
for purposes of impact testing the department considers steel bridge railings and posts as main members .
submit railing shop drawings and erection plans in accordance with section num shop and erection drawings .
num erection tolerances for a bridge on a tangent ensure the railing is visually straight .
in general ensure that the railing does not deviate more than num inch within num horizontal feet .
for a bridge on a curve do not deviate more than num inch from the curve within num horizontal feet .
section num metal railing page num ensure the rail posts are plumb within num inch over the full height .
num protective coating when the contract specifies the railing to be colored powder coat the railing in accordance with section num protective coatings of miscellaneous structural steel unless otherwise specified in the contract .
when the contract specifies railing to be galvanized galvanize in accordance with aashto m num .
num cutting rail posts bevel cut posts to compensate for roadway grade crown and superelevation .
if the roadway grade is less than or equal to one percent num fabricate rail posts perpendicular to the grade line but bevel cut crown and superelevation where necessary .
num caulking rail post base plates before placing rail posts into position on a bridge deck apply a full circle bead of caulking compound on the deck surface around each of the anchor bolts .
after erecting and coating the bridge railing apply a bead of caulking compound around the perimeter of each railpost base plate .
clean the deck surface and the surface of the railpost anchor plates before applying the caulking compound .
num method of measurement the department will measure in place metal railing from end to end .
num basis of payment pay item pay unit metal railing foot num work included in payment the following work and items will be considered as included in the payment for the main items and will not be measured or paid for separately a. submittals nondestructive testing protective coatings b .
additional weight of heavier sections provided solely for the contractors convenience and c. all incidentals necessary for the completion of the work .
section num protective coating of new structural steel page num section num protective coating of new structural steel num description this work consists of applying steel coating materials .
refer to section num protective coating of miscellaneous structural steel for powder coating .
num materials num coating system select a complete system from the .
north east protective coating nepcoat qualified products list provide a three num coat system for all new structural steel .
if the contract does not specify a color use a light gray or aluminum color .
num submittals provide a submittal for the proposed coating option and manufacturer to the project manager at least num days before coating operations .
if the color varies from the specified color the contractor may submit color samples on boards at least eight num inches by ten num inches for review and approval .
the department may take random coating materials samples during the work for testing .
num certification after the department approves the coating material submit notarized manufacturers certificates of compliance stating that the materials are the same as those described in the manufacturers product data sheets .
submit two num notarized certificates of compliance to the department .
num product data sheets provide manufacturers product data sheets and msds with each material certificate of compliance that shows the following num .
mixing and thinning directions num .
recommended spray nozzles and pressures num .
minimum drying time for shop or field applied coats and num .
manufacturer recommended application procedures .
num zinc coatings mechanically galvanize position dowels and anchor bolts in accordance with astm b num class num or hotdip galvanize in accordance with aashto m num .
galvanize bearing parts not welded to structural members in accordance with aashto m num .
blast clean fabricated bearing components before galvanizing .
after steel erection coat galvanized hardware with an epoxy topcoat and a protective coat .
num construction requirements during the coating operations protect structures from blast cleaning operations paint splatter splashes and smirches with protective covering or other methods approved by the project manager .
when the protective devices or procedures are ineffective the project manager may suspend the work until corrections take place .
section num protective coating of new structural steel page num remove blasting and coating debris before reopening the area to traffic .
num surface preparation for priming remove oil grease and other contaminants with methods specified in sspcsp i or other departmentapproved methods .
blastclean the surfaces in preparation for coating in accordance with sspcsp num .
ensure to clean corners pockets reentrant angles splice plates and bolted or riveted connection plates .
remove fins tears slivers and burred or sharp edges found during the blast cleaning operation .
grind and reblast the area to achieve a num mil to num mil surface profile .
use only scaling hammers to remove heavy scale .
do not use chipping hammers that excessively scar the metal .
use blastcleaning abrasives such as dry sand steel shot mineral grit or manufactured grit .
ensure that the abrasives produce a uniform profile from num mil to num mil with an angular pattern as measured in accordance with astm dnum standard test method for pulloff strength of coatings using portable adhesion testers .
use of testex replica tape is common .
remove abrasive and paint residue from steel surfaces with vacuum cleaner equipped with a brushtype cleaning tool or by double blowing .
when using the doubleblowing method vacuum the top surfaces of structural steel after completing the doubleblowing operations .
keep the steel dust free and prime within num h after blast cleaning .
use a wire brush on blast damaged or rusted surfaces and reblast in accordance with sspcsp num .
num coating preparation num mixing coatings mix coatings using a high shear mixer .
do not use paddle mixers or paint shakers .
mix the coatings as much as possible in the original containers .
strain coatings through a no .
num sieve in accordance with aashto m num .
agitate mixed primers continuously from straining to application .
num thinning coatings do not thin the coating material without department approval .
num temperature and weather limitations apply the coating when the air and surface temperatures are above num f and at least num f above the dew point .
apply the coatings when the relative humidity is num or lower .
apply inorganic zinc primers when the relative humidity is num or higher unless otherwise specified by the coating manufacturer .
num coating applications do not apply coatings until the department approves the surface preparation .
the department may waive this approval .
section num protective coating of new structural steel page num have a coating manufacturer representative present to provide technical assistance at the start of each coating operation .
apply the more stringent requirements between those of the coating manufacturer and those in this specification .
vacuum the steel after priming or top coating before applying subsequent coats .
scrub with a mild detergent solution and rinse with water before applying the coating if any of the following conditions exist num .
vacuuming is ineffective num .
more than three num weeks have elapsed since priming the steel or num .
the surface is unfit for further coating .
if more than num days pass between coats completely blast clean the surfaces in accordance with sspcsp num before coating at no additional cost to the department .
num required coatings coat new structural steel components with a zinc rich primer an epoxy topcoat and a urethane protective coat .
apply a urethane protective coat on the following num .
surfaces exposed to sunlight num .
the bottom and outside surfaces of fascia girders including the bottom of the outside top flange num .
the outside surface of the web num .
the top of the outside bottom flange num .
the outside edge of the bottom flange num .
the bottom of the bottom flange and num .
exterior stiffeners .
coat bridge railings in accordance with section num protective coating of miscellaneous structural steel .
num coating options use one num of the following coating options num .
apply the primer topcoat and protective coat in the shop or num .
apply the prime coat in the shop and the topcoat and the protective coat in the field .
num spray equipment apply coatings with spray nozzles at pressures recommended by the coating system manufacturer .
use conventional or airless spray systems to apply the coatings .
when applying field coating of bolted connections use conventional spray equipment .
num film thickness requirements the department will reject the coating if the tooke or banana gauge shows less than the specified minimum thickness for any coating .
provide coating thicknesses in accordance with table num required film thicknesses .
section num protective coating of new structural steel page num table num required film thicknesses coating dry film thickness range mils primer num to num topcoat num to num urethane protective coat num to num determine the dry film thickness using magnetic film thickness gauges .
calibrate the gauges on blasted steel with plastic shims approximately the same thickness as the minimum dry film thickness .
the contractor may use a tooke film thickness gauge to verify coating thickness with the departments approval .
num primer application do not apply primers over blasted steel that has begun to rust or bloom .
apply primer in a smooth wet continuous film .
adjust the spray equipment to apply an even wet coat with minimal overspray .
hold the spray gun at right angles to the surface making even parallel passes with about a num overlap .
apply the primer in two num or more wet coats avoiding heavy coats .
remove dry overspray with light sanding .
prespray edges welds bends and other areas that will likely fail to meet the minimum thickness .
repair deficiently primed areas in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations and as directed by the inspector .
prime coat structural steel surfaces except as noted in section num bolted and welded connections .
give steel bridge sole plates one num coat of zinc rich primer .
maskoff strips where sole plates will be welded to beam flanges and surfaces that will be in contact with elastomeric bearing pads .
after welding apply a primer touchup to the welded areas .
num bolted and welded connections blast clean faying contact surfaces in accordance with sspcsp num and leave uncoated for bolting .
make uncoated areas slightly larger than the contact areas to ensure that the bolted connections clamp down only on the blastcleaned material and not on painted surfaces .
mask off faying areas to protect them from rust during hauling and storage .
apply a rust prohibitor to the faying surfaces or coat the faying areas with a class b primer slip coefficient equal to or greater than num .
the department will approve the rust prohibitor or class b primer .
before bolting remove the rust prohibitor .
do not remove class b primers before bolting unless required .
immediately before bolting ensure the exposed connection areas are in accordance with sspcsp num .
apply the complete coating system to these surfaces after erection .
maskoff coating systems at connections to leave neat lines between the connections and previously coated areas .
after blast cleaning maskoff field weld areas before applying the primer and topcoats .
after field welding clean the welded areas in accordance with sspcsp num and apply the coating system .
section num protective coating of new structural steel page num apply the topcoats on bolted field connections after placing the deck .
num topcoat application after cleaning and before applying the coating system mask opposite sides of the diaphragms and stiffeners over areas that the direct tension indicators will bear on .
do not coat these areas until after erection and bolt tightening .
before applying the topcoat tie coat the galvanized components using manufacturers recommended tie coat material .
apply with a brush .
the project manager will inspect the primed surfaces before the contractor applies the topcoat .
do not apply the topcoat to the following structural steel surfaces num .
faying surfaces of bolted connections section num bolted and welded connections num .
the top flange top surfaces of beams girders or diaphragms to be embedded in concrete num .
bearing surfaces resting on concrete substructures or are subject to sliding and rotational movement and num .
bearing surfaces in contact with elastomeric bearing pads .
spray the topcoat with multiple spray gun passes .
apply a mist coat on the primer .
pre spray edges welds bends and other areas likely to be under the minimum thickness requirements .
apply full wet cross coats separated by a few minutes if necessary to achieve the desired film build with minimal surface bubbling .
on weld seams bolt heads and flange joints it may be necessary to brush thinnedout material to avoid bridging and to fill cracks and crevasses .
num urethane protective coat application apply the urethane protective coat after the topcoat has cured .
apply urethane protective coat in accordance with section num required coatings .
num handling steel protect uncoated faying surfaces to minimize corrosion during shipping and storage .
store structural steel on pallets so it does not rest on dirt .
store beams and girders in an upright as erected position .
use softeners to insulate steel from chains .
pad hooks and stings for hoisting steel .
space parts during shipment so that no rubbing occurs .
use rubber rollers soft support pads or other protective devices on equipment support members or fasteners resting on or attached to newly coated surfaces .
num inspection notify the department at least num days before coating to allow adequate time to plan inspection activities .
after completing erection the project manager will inspect the surfaces to be embedded in concrete .
repair damaged or rusted surfaces before placing decks .
section num protective coating of new structural steel page num after placing the deck and at an agreed upon time the project manager will inspect the entire steel structure for coating system damage .
the project manager will mark damaged areas for repair and will reinspect after repairs are complete .
num final operations num final cleaning clean the steel structure bearings and bridge seat tops after completing coating activities .
num stenciling at the completion of coating operations stencil in four num inch high black letters on the inside of the fascia girders at two num locations designated by the project manager num .
the completion month and year num .
the term section num and num .
the coating manufacturer .
make the markings with the same material used for the urethane protective coats .

section num protective coating of miscellaneous structural steel page num section num protective coating of miscellaneous structural steel num description this work consists of coating new steel bridge railing drop inlet grates cattle guards field coating of new steel piling and other miscellaneous structural steel .
num coating options apply the primer and topcoat in the shop .
new metal bridge railing and pedestrian railing shall be powder coated or galvanized .
num terminology and standards use terminology in accordance with the definitions in volume num systems and specifications of sspcs steel structures painting manual .
use the sspcsp designation when referring to standards specified in the society for protective coatings specifications sspcsp .
num materials num coating system obtain primer and topcoat from one num manufacturer .
select a coating system from the north east protective coating nepcoat qualified products list . .
provide a numcoat system for all miscellaneous structural steel .
use aluminum or light gray for the topcoat color unless otherwise specified in the contract .
num submittals certification and sampling see section num submittals section num certification and section num product data sheets .
num zinc coatings mechanically galvanize position dowels and anchor bolts for bridge railing and bearings in accordance with astm b num class num or hotdip galvanize these items in accordance with aashto m num .
galvanize the portions of bearings not welded to structural members and parts requiring zinc coats in accordance with aashto m num .
num powder coatings obtain primer and topcoat from one num manufacturer .
select a coating system from the departments approved products list .
use light gray for the topcoat color unless otherwise specified in the contract .
num primer use a primer that is zinc rich and a specially formulated thermoset epoxy powder coating designed for use over ferrous metal substrates corvel zinc rich gray num or and approved equal .
num topcoat use a topcoat that is a polyester powder coating designed to provide for maximum uv exposure protection corvel tgic polyester ansi num gray or and approved equal .
num submittals certification and sampling section num protective coating of miscellaneous structural steel page num see section num submittals section num certification and section num product data sheets .
num construction requirements num surface preparation remove contaminants in accordance with sspcsp i or other methods approved by the project manager .
blast clean in accordance with sspcsp num commercial blast cleaning .
remove cleaning residue from steel surfaces with a commercial grade vacuum cleaner or by double blowing .
when double blowing vacuum the top surfaces of structural steel after finishing .
ensure the interiors of rail tubes are free of blasting debris .
maintain the steel dust free and primed for eight num h after blast cleaning .
reclean rusted or contaminated surfaces at no additional cost to the department .
mask areas that require field welding before coating .
after priming the steel clean again before applying the topcoat .
num mixing the coating mix the coating with a high shear mixer to a smooth and lumpfree consistency in accordance with the coating manufacturers specifications .
mix the coating as much as possible in the original containers and continue mixing until the metallic powder or pigment is in suspension .
keep mixed primers continuously agitated before and during application .
num thinning the coating do not thin the coatings without the approval of the project manager .
if it is necessary to thin the coatings thin the material in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
num temperature and weather limitations only apply the coatings when the ambient air temperature and surface temperature of the steel are both above num f and at least five num f above the dew point .
do not apply the coatings when there is condensation or frost on the metal surfaces .
do not apply the coatings when the relative humidity is higher than num percent .
num coating applications do not apply coating until the department approves the surface preparation .
the department may waive this inspection .
coat in accordance with sspcpa num .
prespray areas that are likely to not achieve the minimum coating thickness when the larger areas are sprayed .
repair coated areas where the primer or topcoat runs sags or cracks .
section num protective coating of miscellaneous structural steel page num do not apply the topcoat until the primer has fully cured .
allow the manufacturers minimum recommended cure time to lapse between coats .
if more than num days elapse between the primer application and the topcoat application contact the coating system manufacturer for surface preparation recommendations before applying the topcoat .
apply the more stringent requirements between those of the coating manufacturer and those in this specification .
the department may accept minor cosmetic defects in ground level miscellaneous structural steel components not in public view if the defects will not affect durability .
num required coating of components apply the primer and topcoat to steel surfaces except those that will contact elastomeric bearing pads or are subject to sliding and rotational movements .
coat new steel piling from the bottoms of the pier caps to two num ft below the finished grade or streambed elevations .
num coating of sole plates for concrete bridges deliver sole plates to the project with one num coat of primer applied to all surfaces except maskedoff strips where the sole plates will be welded to the shoe plates and surfaces that will contact elastomeric bearing pads .
before installation clean surfaces that will contact pads in accordance with sspcsp num .
clean off all rust on sole plates prior to installing and welding .
after installing the pads and welding the sole plates to the shoe plates touch up the primer and apply topcoat to exposed surfaces .
num coating of galvanized components apply tie coats to galvanized components in accordance with the coating manufacturers recommendations .
brush the tie coats if necessary .
after erecting the steel topcoat the galvanized hardware .
num spray equipment apply the coatings with spray nozzles at the manufacturerrecommended pressures .
num film thickness requirements apply coatings in accordance with table num required film thicknesses .
table num required film thicknesses coating dry film thickness range mils primer num topcoat num use a magnetic film thickness gage or an electronic film thickness detector to determine dry film thickness .
num coating of powder coated components section num protective coating of miscellaneous structural steel page num prepare the surfaces in accordance with section num surface preparation and additionally an iron or zinc phosphate wash shall be included to provide longterm corrosion protection .
num primer application apply the zinc rich epoxy primer to a minimum of num mils dry film thickness and leave in the oven long enough for the powder to melt flow out and gel but not to cure .
num topcoat application apply the polyester topcoat to a minimum of num mils dry film thickness before the primer has cured .
num fixturing suspend the materials by suitable metal hooks or fixtures to provide a sufficient electrical grounding path for the materials .
affix the materials with a minimum of direct contact area with the fixture device .
num curing place the powdercoated material in a suitable oven and cure per the manufacturers recommended cure cycle .
remove the material from the oven and allow to cool .
visually inspect the material to ensure a smooth continuous uniform finish free from runs sags or defects .
num touchup painting touchup areas of the material that were not powder coated with a liquid paint using a brush or aerosol of the same color as the original powder coating .
touchup epoxy powder coating with an epoxy liquid paint meeting military specification milcnum .
touchup polyester powder coating with a urethane liquid paint meeting military specification milc num .
num handling steel handle or load newly coated structural steel only with a cured coating .
store on pallets or in other approved ways so that the steel does not rest on dirt .
insulate steel from binding chains with approved softeners .
hoist with padded hooks and slings .
space parts during shipment to ensure that no rubbing occurs .
num provisions for inspection notify the department at least num working days before coating to allow time to plan an inspection .
num field repair field repair coated areas that are rusted or damaged .
clean the surface with methods approved by the project manager .
blast clean large areas in accordance with sspcsp num .
use power tools with abrasive disks to clean small areas .
apply both coats on areas that rusted or experienced fullthickness damage .
prime large areas using spray equipment brush or roller .
prime small areas with a brush .
spray or brush the topcoat .
section num protective coating of miscellaneous structural steel page num two num or more coats may be necessary to build up the required film thickness .
apply topcoat only to areas where the topcoat is damaged .
requirements of section num apply to field repairs .
num protection of the work and public protect structures during coating operations with a protective covering or with other methods approved by the project manager .
num method of measurementreserved num basis of payment the department will pay for the coating system as incidental to structural steel in accordance with section num steel structures .

if another color is specified in the contract select an approved system that is also available in the specified color .

num construction requirements num surface preparation of existing bridges and structures num solvent sspcsp num and handtool sspcspnum cleaning clean exposed areas in accordance with sspcsp num .
the project manager may approve scrubbing with water and a mild detergent to supplement solvent cleaning .
clean small areas showing minor damage or deterioration with handtools in accordance with sspcsp num or with powertools in accordance with sspcsp num .
contain and remove cleaning debris .
num powertool cleaning to bare metal sspcsp num clean large corroded areas and areas that show moderate to severe corrosion in accordance with sspcsp num powertool cleaning to bare metal .
the project manager will mark additional areas for cleaning in accordance with sspcsp num .
clean at least two num inches beyond the damaged areas in all directions .
section num recoating structures page num feather the exposed edges of the cleaned areas in accordance with sspcsp num .
do not leave ragged edges of intact paint .
during and after powertool cleaning use a high efficiency vacuum to remove the residue .
the department will accept these surfaces by visually comparing them to a prepared standard on the project .
prepare a project standard by powertool cleaning an area designated for recoating .
before cleaning ensure that the prepared standard is in accordance with sspcvis num visual standard for power and handtool cleaned steel pictorial standard e sp num f sp num and g sp num and obtain department approval .
prepare at least one num standard for each structure .
more than one num standard may be necessary if the cleaned steel differs significantly from the photographic standards .
for recoating bridges make the standard at least one num ft one num ft. for recoating bridge railing or minor structures the standard may be smaller .
protect the project standard from corrosion and contamination by applying a clear polyurethane coat .
upon completing the cleaning work reclean and coat the standard .
if the standard becomes deteriorated or ineffective reestablish it at no additional cost to the department .
when replacing a concrete bridge deck do not clean or coat the top surfaces of top flanges of beams and girders and shear connectors .
num powertool sspcsp num cleaning remove poorly adhering topcoats .
roughen the primer surface with powertools in accordance with sspcsp num .
the department will accept results in accordance with sspc sp num brushoff blast cleaning .
clean large areas of the structure with a powertool sspcsp num to remove topcoats that adhere poorly in accordance with the plans or as directed by the project manager .
ensure the final prepared surface is free of poorly adhering paint oil grease dust loose mill scale and loose rust .
tightly adhering paint mill scale and rust may remain .
use powertools with attached vacuum systems capable of containing the resulting dust .
maintain airborne dusts and leadcontaining residues below the osha action level .
num coating num mixing the coatings mix the coatings with a highshear mixer in accordance with the coating manufacturers directions until the material is smooth and lumpfree .
do not use paddle mixers or paint shakers .
mix the material as far as possible in its original container and continue mixing until the metallic powder or pigment is in suspension .
thoroughly disperse the coating solids that may have settled to the bottom of the container .
continuously agitate mixed coatings until application .
num thinning the coating do not thin the coatings without the approval of the project manager .
if it is necessary to thin the coatings thin the material in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
num coating application apply the primer and topcoat with a brush roller or by spraying preferred .
use nozzles and pressures in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
prespray or prebrush corners edges bolt and rivet heads and nuts to ensure adequate film thickness .
section num recoating structures page num perform coating in accordance with sspcpa num .
num temperature and weather limitations num temperature apply the coating when the air and surface temperatures are above num f and at least num f above the dew point .
do not apply coatings on metal surfaces with condensation or frost .
num humidity do not apply the coatings when the relative humidity is above num .
if the relative humidity is below num follow the manufacturers coating directions to ensure proper curing .
num priming before priming use a commercial grade vacuum equipped with a brushtype cleaning tool to remove deleterious material .
do not double blow .
the department will approve areas cleaned in accordance with sspcsp num sspcsp num sspcsp num or sspcsp num before application of the primer or topcoat .
prime coat all surfaces .
apply primer the same day as cleaning unless otherwise authorized by the project manager .
reclean surfaces that develop rust or are contaminated with deleterious material before coating at no additional cost to the department .
num topcoat vacuum the surface before applying the topcoat .
if vacuuming is ineffective or if in the project manager determines the surface is unfit for top coating scrub with a mild detergent and rinse with water before top coating .
ensure the primer is cured and dry before applying the topcoat .
allow the manufacturers recommended maximum time to lapse between coats .
num thickness of coatings refer to the nepcoat qualified products list m for the required thicknesses of the coatings .
determine dry film thicknesses with magnetic or electronic film thickness gauges .
num protection of the work and public during surface preparation and coating operations protect structures with protective covering or other methods approved by the project manager .
if the protective devices or procedures are ineffective the project manager may suspend work until corrections are complete .
num final operations recaulk railing post base plate perimeters with silicon or synthetic rubber caulking compounds in accordance with federal specifications ttsnuma or ttsnumc .
num method of measurement the project manager will measure cleaned areas in accordance with sspcsp num and section num recoating structures page num sspcsp num before the application of the prime coat .

section num treated timber page num section num treated timber num description this work consists of constructing timber structures and the timber portions of composite structures .

meet grading rules and design values in accordance with supplement to the national design specifications for wood construction .
num preservatives and treatment methods treat timber with preservatives in accordance with aashto m num .
unless otherwise specified in the contract use pentachlorophenol type c preservative treatment in accordance with awpa pnum and pnum .
num fasteners provide bolts nuts and washers in accordance with astm a num .
provide bolts that have standard square or hex heads and coarse threads with class num tolerances in accordance with ansis standard specifications for bolted connections .
provide washers that bear on timber surfaces in accordance with table num washer dimensions .
table num washer dimensions bolt diameter hole diameter washer diameter washer thickness num num num num num num num num num num num num num num provide shear plates and split ring connectors in accordance with the contract .
the department will not accept connector plates with punchedthrough spikes or nailer plates .
provide shear plates split ring connectors and accompanying washers made of pressed steel or malleable iron in accordance with aitcs timber construction manual .
use nails cut from round wire of standard form .
use cut or wire spikes .
use galvanized metal fasteners in accordance with aashto m num .
tap galvanized nuts oversize after galvanizing in accordance with section num of aashto m numm and section num of aashto m numm .
provide steel plates in accordance with astm anum galvanize in accordance with aashto m num or m num .

the department will return one num set with notations .

details num .

num .

timber grade and species num .
preservative treatment type composition and percent retention num .
an erection diagram showing piece marks locations orientations and attachment methods for structure components or pieces and num .
special instructions required regarding structure fabrication or erection .
num fabrication cut and frame lumber and timber so that the joints have an even bearing over the entire contact surfaces .
tag prefabricated members with erection marks for identification and reference them in the erection drawings .
unless otherwise specified fabricate as far ahead of treatment as possible .
num bolt holes unless otherwise specified in the contract bore holes perpendicular to the faces of the members they penetrate .
bore connection holes for one num or two num bolts at the same diameter as the finished bolt except bolt holes which are part of a shear plate or splitring assembly .
bore holes num inch larger than the bolt diameter for bolted connections using more than two num bolts and for bolt holes which are part of a shear plate or splitring assembly .
section num treated timber page num drill holes in connector plates num inch larger than the bolt diameter .
num holes for lag screws for lag screws bore holes with a bit no larger than the minor diameter of the lag screw thread .
to prevent splitting or stripping the threads bore shank holes in the side of the joint containing the thread to the same diameter and to the same depth as the shank .
ensure that holes for the shank in connected parts wood or metal are from num inch to num inch greater than the diameter of the shank .
make the hole depths approximately one num inch less than the length under the head .
num recesses and countersinking countersink when the contract requires a smooth or flush surface .
treat recesses in treated timber formed for shear plates splitring connectors or countersinking in accordance with section num preservative treatment .
num stringers size stringers at bearings and place so that knots near edges are in the top portions of the stringers .
the contractor may construct outside stringers butt joints with the ends dapped or cut on a taper .
unless otherwise specified in the contract overlap interior stringers at each end to take the bearing over the full floor beam or cap width .
num cross bridging toenail wood cross bridging between stringers with at least two num nails in each end .
ensure the cross bridging members have full bearing at each end against the stringer sides .
use metal cross bridging members in accordance with the contract or as approved by the department .
num trusses ensure the following num .
completed trusses show no line irregularities num .
chords are straight and true from end to end in horizontal projection and num .
chords show a smooth curve through panel points in vertical projection .
the department will reject pieces with uneven or rough cuts at the bearing points .
num bolts and washers install washers under bolt heads and nuts unless using a steel plate or strap in conjunction with shear plates .
if necessary use washers to extend the bolt length to prevent metal connection plates from bearing on the threaded portion of the bolt .
num nailing unless otherwise specified drive nails and spikes perpendicular to the surface of the timber with just enough force to set the heads flush with the surface of the wood .
the department may reject surfaces with deep hammer marks considered evidence of poor workmanship .
num preservative treatment section num treated timber page num apply preservative treatment in accordance with awpa unum and tnum .
num marking ensure that each piece of treated timber has a legible brand mark or tag indicating the treatment facility name and the specification symbol or specification requirements identifying the treatment used .
place the brands or marks so that they are not visible after the structure is erected .
num inspection at the treatment plant the contractor is responsible for inspection of materials and preservative treatment .
ensure that inspections are conducted in accordance with aashto m num wpa standards .
the department and the american wood preservers bureau must approve the inspection agencies .
the department may conduct surveillance inspections at any time .
num inspection at the job site the department may retest the materials after delivery to the project .
the department will accept timber within five percent num of specified moisture content and preservative retention .
num handling handle treated timber with web slings .
do not use devices that mar wood surfaces such as cant hooks peaveys and pikes .
if using metal bands to bundle members provide comer protectors to prevent damage to the treated timber .
num storage of material store lumber and timber on the project in orderly stacks .
stack material on supports at least num inches above the ground surface .
keep the ground in the vicinity of the timber cleared of weeds and rubbish .
do not allow water to collect under or near the stored timber .
if required by the project manager provide protection from the weather with a covering .
num erection treat cuts abrasions and recesses that occur after treatment with two num liberal applications of a compatible preservative in accordance with awpa mnum .
treat holes bored after treatment by filling the holes with the preservative used for field treatment .
use preservative treated plugs to plug holes not permanently filled with bolts or screws .
tighten bolts securely but not enough to crush the wood beneath the plates or washers .
the department will reject members that will not assemble after application of reasonable amounts of force .
num method of measurement num treated timber the department will use standard nominal dimensions and actual member lengths in accordance with the contract or approved modifications to measure treated timber .

section num elastomeric bearing pads page num section num elastomeric bearing pads num description this work consists of providing assembling and installing elastomeric bridge bearing pads .
num materials num general provide bearing pad material and testing in accordance with the contract and aashtos lrfd bridge construction specification section num .
provide plain or laminated bearing pads reinforced with steel or fabric laminates .
reinforce bearing pads over num inch thick with laminates spaced no greater than num inch apart through the entire thickness .
provide shim thicknesses not less than num inch .
num certification furnish certified laboratory test results on the elastomer properties of compound for both plain and laminated bearings .
the required tests are per aashto m num table num .
for bridges north of inum and including inum the elastomer compound shall be grade num .
for bridges south of inum the elastomer compound shall be grade num .
test shall be done on an annual basis or when the material supplier changes .
provide copies of certified mill test reports for laminated bearing steel and any required steel components .
num marking using indelible ink or paint that will remain intact after pad deformation mark each laminated bearing pad on a face that is visible after bridge erection with the following information num .
order number num .
lot number num .
bearing identification number num .
elastomer type and num .
grade number .
num acceptance criteria the following tests shall be performed on the actual bearing pads .
one num bearing pad per lot shall be tested .
the bearing pad shall be tested per aashto m num section num .
the average compressive load shall be num psi for laminated bearing pads and num psi for plain bearing pads .
the bearing pad shall be tested per aashto m num section num .
where the bearing strain exceeds ten percent num the lot shall be rejected .
if the bearing pad design loads are not shown on the contract drawings the test will not be required .
testing is to be performed by the manufacturer laboratory with the certified test results submitted to nmdot .
num fabrication cast bearing pads with steel laminates as a unit in a mold bonded and vulcanized under heat and pressure .
provide molds with a standard mold finish .
sandblast internal steel laminates to remove surface coating rust and mill scale before bonding .
provide internal steel laminates free of sharp edges and burrs with a minimum edge cover of num inch .
section num elastomeric bearing pads page num manufacture as a single unit bearing pads designed to act as a single unit with a given shape .
the contractor may provide molded or extruded plain bearing pads or fabric reinforced bearings pads vulcanized in large sheets and cut to size .
cut without heating the materials and to produce a smooth finish in accordance with ansi num with no fabric separation from the elastomer .
provide single ply fabric reinforcement at the top and bottom of the reinforced bearings and double ply for internal reinforcement layers .
provide fabric free of folds and ripples and parallel to the top and bottom surfaces .
provide flash tolerances finishes and appearances are in accordance with the current rubber handbook published by the rubber manufacturers association inc. rma fnum and t.num for molded bearings and rma fnum for extruded bearings .
num tolerances build plain and laminated bearing pads in accordance with table num bearing pad tolerances .
table num bearing pad tolerances parameter description tolerance requirements overall vertical thickness num num inch or less over num num inch num inch to num inch num inch to num inch overall horizontal dimensions num inch and less over num inch num inch to num inch num inch to num inch individual layer thickness a num of design value but no more than num inch variations from a plane parallel to the theoretical surface b top c sides num radians num radians position of exposed connection members num inch embedded steel plates edge cover or connection members num in to num inch hole slot or insert sizes num inch hole slot or insert positions num inch aelastomerlaminated bearing pads only .
bas determined by measurements at the bearing edges .
cslope relative to the bottom .
num construction requirements num general ensure bearing pads in the completed structure exhibit a compressive strain of no more than ten percent num .
place bearing pads on level surfaces .
correct misalignments in the support to form a level surface .
do not weld steel girders or base plates to the bearing pad sole plates unless there is section num elastomeric bearing pads page num more than num num inch of steel between the weld and the elastomer .
do not expose the elastomer or elastomer bond to temperatures greater than num f. num method of measurement reserved num basis of payment the furnishing and installing of elastomeric bearing pads will be considered incidental to the completion of the work and no measurement or direct payment will be made therefore .
section num elastomeric compression joint seals page num section num elastomeric compression joint seals num description this work consists of providing and placing elastomeric compression joint seals for bridge decks .
num materials num general provide joint seals that prevent debris and water intrusion through the joint system .
provide preformed open cell seals manufactured with elastomeric polychloroprene material in accordance with aashto m num .
mark the top surface of joint seals .
num dimensional tolerance provide seals in accordance with the contract and manufacturers tolerances .
num splicing provide seals in one continuous strip for each joint .
num lubricant adhesive provide lubricant adhesives in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
num submittals provide a submittal to the project manager with the manufacturer name seal type and supplier name within one num month after the contract is awarded .
at least num days before installation submit to the project manager a copy of the manufacturers seal installation recommendations .
num construction requirements num preparing joint recesses install joint seals in prefabricated steel recesses or in recesses saw cut in the concrete .
for saw cut recesses cut the joints narrower than required for the preformed seal material .
before installing compression seals saw cut a groove to receive the seal material along the top of the joint .
simultaneously cut both sides of a groove .
control alignment with a rigid guide .
the department will specify the groove width based on the temperature and age of the concrete .
bevel saw cut lips to prevent subsequent spalling .
repair spalls cracks and protrusions in the joint surface before installing seals .
set prefabricated steel recesses before placing the deck slab .
ensure joint surfaces are free of paint oil scale rust and dust before applying the lubricant adhesive .
num oversized joint openings the contractor may use larger seals for oversized joint openings at no additional cost to the department .
num installation section num elastomeric compression joint seals page num apply the lubricant adhesive to both joint faces before installing the seal .
compress the seal to the thickness required in the contract or as specified by the state bridge engineer for the rated opening and temperature conditions .
the department will not allow loose fits or open points between the seal and the deck concrete or metal armoring .
num replacing joint seals in existing decks if replacing seals in existing bridge decks completely remove the old seals and clean the side surfaces of the openings of all dirt rust and any other deleterious material .
if required modify existing joint components or deck slab openings before installing the replacement seals .
num acceptance after installation test joint seals for leakage by water flooding the joint .
perform testing in the presence of the project manager .
ensure the top edges of the seal are in continuous contact with the sides of the joint opening over the entire range of joint movement or the department may reject the seal .
num method of measurementreserved num basis of payment pay item pay unit elastomeric compression joint seal replacement foot section num bridge joint strip seals page num section num bridge joint strip seals num description this work consists of providing assembling and installing bridge joint strip seal assemblies per the standard drawings for bridge joint strip seals .
num materials num general provide bridge joint strip seals of elastomeric material and metal components to allow expansion and contraction of the bridge superstructure and to seal the deck surface .
anchor bridge joint strip seal assemblies either directly in pcc with type a anchorage or in elastomeric concrete headers or end dams with type b anchorage .
unless noted on the plans type a anchorage should be used .

bafter num h at num f. cdurometer a. dat num elongation and num pphm in air at num f. eusing astm oil num after num h at num f. fafter num h at num f in calcium chloride solution .

num fabrication of steel components fabricate steel components in accordance with section num steel structures .
stamp manufacturers name and model number at a visible location on each end of the steel extrusion .
num protective coating unless otherwise specified in the contract coat or galvanize the surfaces of steel components in accordance with section num protective coatings of miscellaneous structural steel .
num manufacturers technical support representative ensure an elastomeric concrete manufacturers technical support representative is at the site during installation to num .
advise and ensure adherence to the correct installation method num .
train assigned personnel in the correct methods of installation and num .
certify to the project manager that the contractor installed the material in accordance with the manufacturers instructions .
both the representative and the contractor shall sign and date written certifications for the project manager .
num temperature and weather limitations do not place elastomeric concrete when the air or material temperatures are below num f. do not place elastomeric concrete during rain or snow .
num placement temperatures preheat the ingredients of the elastomeric concrete in accordance with the manufacturers instructions and maintain the preheat temperatures within the specified section num bridge joint strip seals page num tolerances .
num surface preparation immediately before placing the elastomeric concrete sandblast the surfaces of steel concrete and asphalt that will contact elastomeric concrete .
completely remove dirt rust grease oil and other deleterious material .
after blasting remove loose dirt sand and debris by vacuuming or blowing with dry oilfree compressed air .
ensure surfaces are completely dry before placing the elastomeric concrete .
num priming before placing elastomeric concrete prime the steel concrete and asphalt surfaces that will contact elastomeric concrete material in accordance with the elastomeric concrete manufacturers recommendations .
num placement of the steel extrusions place steel extrusions num num inch below and parallel to the final deck elevations .
remove and replace joints with extrusions that protrude above final deck elevations at no additional cost to the department .
unless otherwise specified in the contract install block outs that have at least a num inch clearance between the steel extrusions and the blockout bottoms if using elastomeric headers .
the contractor may field splice steel retaining bars by welding at the crown point of the roadway and at approximately num foot intervals in the remaining length of the seal .
the department will not allow any other field splicing .
num mixing and placing of the elastomeric concrete install elastomeric concrete headers in accordance with the manufacturers instructions .
if there is a conflict between this specification and the manufacturers printed instructions use the more stringent requirements .
during mixing and placement operations do not spill or spread elastomeric concrete on deck surfaces or steel extrusion parts that are not part of header construction .
perform mixing off the bridge deck .
use plywood sheets and plastic sheeting to protect the bridge deck for longer bridges where this is not practical .
place forms along the void edges beneath the steel extrusions .
place and compact elastomeric concrete the entire length of the header to eliminate voids and leakage .
the project manager may reject the installation if the elastomeric concrete has any of the following characteristics num .
contains voids or honeycombs beneath steel extrusions num .
creates a poor finish num .
sets before being fully placed and consolidated num .
is not properly bonded to the steel and the concrete substrate or num .
shows signs of delamination .
num placement of elastomeric concrete in vertical recesses at curb sidewalk or barrier joint upturns follow procedures for placement of the elastomeric concrete into the vertical recesses without voids or honeycombs .
num heat vulcanizing heat vulcanize the concrete after placement if specified in the manufacturers instructions .
section num bridge joint strip seals page num num placement of elastomeric sealing element provide and install the sealing element in one continuous piece and in accordance with the manufacturers instructions .
do not field splice the sealing element .
num acceptance provide an installed seal that is undamaged and prevents moisture and other contaminants on the deck surface from leaking through the joints .
after installation test the bridge joint strip seals for leaks by flooding with water .
perform testing in the presence of the project manager .

steel components of the bridge joint strip seal b. elastomeric concrete headers c. leak testing including water for leak test d. providing manufacturers representatives and installation certification e. protective coating of steel components .

num manufacturers instructions provide a complete set of written joint installation instructions to the project manager at least num days before installing the joints .
num joint preparation allow concrete in new bridge joints to cure for at least seven num days before installing sealing material .
clean bridge joints in new or existing concrete with a sandblaster before placing the sealant materials .
obtain the project managers approval to use other cleaning methods .
before priming the joints remove loose debris with a vacuum or blower .
use oil and moisturefree compressed air for sandblasting or blowing debris .
dry joints before applying primers and sealants .
num inspection before installation inspect joints for proper depth width alignment and preparation and obtain project manager approval before installing the sealant material .
num application of sealing element install a backer rod at least num larger in diameter than the joint opening or a diameter specified by the manufacturer to the specified depth .
before applying sealant prime the substrate surfaces in accordance with the sealant manufacturer specifications .
place sealant when the air and substrate temperatures are from num f to num f and maintain at or above num f for at least num h. apply sealant in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations using an approved applicator .

silicone or polyurethane sealants are normally ready for traffic upon removal of the traffic control devices .

num closed cell foam joint seal use a joint seal that a. is an impermeable closedcell crosslinked ethylene vinyl acetate low density polyethylene copolymer nitrogen blown foam material b. has a minimum working range of num compression and num tension c. meets or exceeds the requirements listed in table num below d. has num inch deep by num inch wide grooves spaced at ¼ inch to ½ inch along both sides of the joint and running the entire length of the joint to increase bond surface area e. is resistant to degradation due to ultraviolet radiation f. is self extinguishing g. is resistant to abrasion oxidation oils gasoline road salts and other petroleum products that may be spilled on the surface .

num pipe num metal pipe provide helical corrugated pipe that have rerolled ends with at least two num annular corrugations .
if using stab joints only one num end may have a factory attached coupling as appropriate for the end .
the following ends of pipe do not have to be rerolled num .
connected to an existing pipe with helical corrugations num .
connecting to an end section or num .
to be embedded in concrete .
the department will allow direct connection of end sections utilizing a dimple band for cut ends on existing pipe and straps or rods on new installations .
use a half smooth half corrugated sleeve or a concrete collar for extensions of concrete pipe to metal pipe .
if using smooth interior lined steel culvert pipe double wall provide lock seams of the smooth interior liner and the corrugated shell that are continuous from end to end of each length of pipe section .
ensure the exterior gauge is not less than the specified gauge in the contract for unlined corrugated steel culvert pipe .
the interior metal lines shall be at least num inch .
use pipe with gasketed lock seams and rerolled ends for watertight installations .
joints must meet the requirements per section num .
num reinforced concrete pipe provide reinforced concrete pipe rcp with a bell and spigot design or a tongue and groove design .
the contractor may use lift holes or lifting anchors to handle and place rcp .
do not use more than two num lift holes in the wall of each piece of pipe .
place lift at the top of the pipe in line with the centerline of the pipe and along the minor axis of the reinforcement .
when using a single lift hole the contractor shall place it at the balance point .
when using two num lift holes the contractor will place them equidistant from the balance point .
the lift holes shall not interfere with the load carrying capacity of the pipe shall be neatly made shall be straight and may be either drilled or cast .
after the contractor has placed the pipe and before beginning backfill operations the contractor shall fill the lift holes with num .
nonshrink mortar in accordance with section num nonshrink mortar num .

nonshrink grout in accordance with section num nonshrink grout for post tensioned bridge members .
num plastic pipe when required for thermoplastic pipe provide end sections located out of the clear zone that are either metal or hdpe with a minimum two percent num carbon black in accordance with astm d num .

provide record heat numbers and supply chemical analysis for metal pipe .

num selecting pipe the contractor may select any approved type of pipe unless otherwise specified .
if the plans specify storm drain culvert pipes the contractor may select an approved type with a maximum tested mannings coefficient of roughness of num .
if the plans specify siphon culvert pipes the contractor may select an approved pressure pipe .
select a type of pipe based on the corrosion resistance number in accordance with section num corrosion resistance number except when using siphon culvert pipe .
if the plans specify a nominal diameter for pipe arch the contractor may supply arched or elliptical pipe equal to the nominal round pipe .
num joints select the appropriate joint in accordance with table num joint selection .
table num joint selection type of pipe structure soil tight water tight pressure tight restrained culverts under turnouts not under road x cross drain culverts x elbowed drop culverts x x a c storm drains x b rundowns or downdrains a x x a c section num pipe culverts page num table num joint selection type of pipe structure soil tight water tight pressure tight restrained pond outlet pipes and risers x irrigation pipe nonpressure x b irrigation siphons and sag pipes pressure x ause where pipe slopes are steep num and or velocities are high .
belliptical and arched concrete and steel arch pipe joints are not considered watertight without special joint design considerations for rcp refer to section num rcp joint material for cmp refer to section num cmp joint material or as approved by project manager .
crcp and cmp only .
num joint types num soiltight joints a soiltight joint does not allow migration of soil into the pipe .
num watertight joints a gasketed joint restricts infiltrationexfiltration and exhibits no visible leakage when subject to num psi over the crown for ten num min under testing conditions as outlined in the appropriate product astm specification .
when plant tested the appropriate product joint shall meet the requirements of astm d num thermoplastic or steel reinforced polyethylene astm c numc num concrete or astmanum metal .
num pressuretight joints use pressure pipe in accordance with section num utility items and the associated sections of the new mexico standard specifications for public works construction nmsspwc .
provide pipe with a pressure rating equal to or greater than the static head shown on the drawings .
select materials in accordance with table num pressure tight joint materials .
test pressuretight installations used in siphons and sag pipes shall show no leakage in excess of the allowable line leakage requirement when filled with water to the highest operating elevation and allowed to stand full for num h. the minimum coupling requirement will be in accordance with the testing requirements of aashtos lrfd bridge construction specifications section num num for standard joints in nonerodible soils .

do not use expanding sealants or gaskets .

the bell shall be reinforced with a polymer composite band installed by the manufacturer .

section num pipe culverts page num num excavation and backfill excavate trenches in accordance with section num excavation and backfill for culverts and minor structures .
make the trenches wide enough to properly join the pipe and thoroughly compact the bedding material under and around the pipe .
where possible make the trench wall vertical .
when using flowable fill for backfill in accordance with section num flowable fill make trench widths in accordance with aashtos lrfd bridge construction specifications section num for metal pipe and steel reinforced polyethylene pipe section num for rcp and section num for thermoplastic pipe .
refer to nmdot num standard drawings for additional pipe installation requirements .
num fill height requirements provide minimum and maximum cover over the pipe in accordance with the standard drawings .
num laying pipe begin laying pipe at the downstream end of the pipeline except for extensions of existing pipes .
place the bottom of the pipe in contact with the shaped bedding throughout its full length .
place the bell ends or outside circumferential laps of pipes facing upstream to obtain a shingling effect .
place pipe with longitudinal laps or seams with the laps or seams at the sides .
lay paved or partially lined pipe so that the longitudinal centerline of the paved segment coincides with the flow line .
place elliptical and elliptically reinforced pipes with the major axis within num of a horizontal plane .
num joining pipe num joining rcp join pipe sections so that the ends are fully centered and the inner surfaces are flush within the inside diameter tolerance variations of aashto m num but shall not exceed num inch .
make watertight joints with the following num .
cement grout num .
flexible watertight gaskets num .
external sealing bands or num .
any combination of these types .
for grouted joints molds or runners shall be used to retain the poured grout .
flexible watertight gaskets shall be installed to form a flexible watertight seal .
if using portland cement mixtures protect the completed joints against rapid drying with a curing method approved by the project manager .
replace coupling systems that do not fit snugly in accordance with section num reinforced concrete pipe at no additional cost to the department .
num joining flexible pipe join metal or thermoplastic pipe with a flexible pipe coupling system .
ensure the coupling systems engage an equal number of corrugation or length on either side of the pipe joint .
replace coupling systems that do not fit snugly to the pipe ends in accordance with section num cmp joint material and section num thermoplastic joint material at no additional cost to the department .
section num pipe culverts page num use dimpled bands to attach end sections .
ensure the dimples fit snugly within the given pipes corrugations .
if the dimpled band connections do not fit correctly use an alternate way to connect the pipes .
where joints must have beveled ends to meet construction requirements form a continuous unit in accordance with the plans .
make water tight joints using a bell and spigot conforming to astm dnum and fnum .
push spigot into bell end so spigot reaches homing mark on bell end .
repair damaged protective coatings in accordance with aashto m num at no additional cost to the department .
num pipe installation inspection inspect the pipe before placing any backfill .
replace or relay unacceptable pipe at no additional cost to the department .
ensure that pipe is installed in full compliance with aashtos lrfd bridge construction specification section num metal and steel reinforced polyethylene pipe section num rcp or section num thermoplastic requirements .
for thermoplastic pipe provide the department with the results of the deflection test detailed in section num of aashtos lrfd bridge construction specification and a certification that the testing was completed .
the required deflection testing shall be performed at no additional cost to the department .
num salvaging culvert pipe remove culvert pipe to be salvaged or reinstalled from the existing location in accordance with section num removal of structures and obstructions .
clean salvaged pipe of deleterious material before storing or reinstalling .

num design and certification requirements num design the contractor is responsible for the structural and foundation designs of metal box culverts and other structural plate structures .

complete design calculations num .
shop drawings and num .
construction details and installation instructions for longspan structural plate structures and metal box culverts .

num construction requirements num assembling when practical connect plates with the seams and stagger them so that no more than three num plates come together at one num point .
assemble structural plate structures using bolts with a minimum num inch diameter .
if assembling steel structural plates apply from num lbfft to num lbfft of torque .
section num structural plate structures page num if assembling aluminum structural plates apply from num lbfft to num lbfft of torque .
tighten the longitudinal seams of joined plates except for plates held in shape by cables struts or backfill .
num assembly tolerances ensure that the plates do not vary from the specified dimension before backfill by more than two percent num of the longest dimension span or rise or five num inches whichever is less .
however only apply the two percent num restriction for horizontal ellipse shapes having a ratio of top to side radii of three num or less .
when the rise of arches with a ratio of top to side radii of three num or more ensure that they do not vary from the specified dimension by more than one percent num of the span .
num welding weld steel in accordance with ansiaashtoaws bridge welding code dnum .
weld aluminum in accordance with aws structural welding code dnum .
ensure that qualified welders perform shop and field welding in accordance with section num of ansiaashtoaws bridge welding code dnum .
perform welding on steel plates other than fittings before galvanizing .
num rejection of damaged materials the department may reject damaged or defective structural plate structures or structural plates at any time during the construction operations regardless of prior approval .
replace installed structures or plates that are damaged or that fail to meet the restrictions of structure shape in accordance with section num assembly tolerances at no additional cost to the department .
num movement monitoring in long span structural plate structures place movement control devices at locations specified by the manufacturer for the entire length of the structure .
ensure that a qualified manufacturers representative continually monitors longspan structural plate structures for movement to detect excessive distortion of the structure shape due to progressive plate assembly and equipment and backfilling operations .
the department will determine excessive distortion in accordance with section num assembly tolerances and as a radius change more than num of the lower side plate of highprofile arches and the side plate of pearshaped structures .
upon completion of the structure submit the movement measurement records to the project manager with a statement certifying that any movements were within acceptable limits .
num excavation perform excavation in accordance with section num excavation and backfill for culverts and minor structures .
num bedding and backfill construct bedding material for culverts with closed bottoms in accordance with section num excavation and backfill for culverts and minor structures .
ensure that the backfill and bedding are in accordance with table num electrochemical criteria to ensure a numyear service life .

num backfill ensure that backfill material is in accordance with soil classification anum or anum in aashto m num and compact it to at least num of maximum density in accordance with aashto t num modified proctor method d ttcp modified .
to avoid damaging the structure compact the initial two num ft of backfill over the crown of the structure with hand held equipment or small compaction machinery .
the department defines the crown as the area between the points of compound curvature of top and side plates or the area between the location of longitudinal structural stiffeners .
the department will not apply density requirements to the first two num lifts of backfill placed over the crown of the structure .
do not allow heavy machinery on the structures except for metal box culverts until the fill over the structure is at least four num ft deep or num of the span whichever is greater .
num repair of damaged coating repair damaged protective coating in accordance with aashto m num at no additional cost to the department .
use zincrich paint in accordance with federal specification ttp num or milpnum .
