num materialsreserved num construction requirementsreserved num method of measurement num payment procedures if the contractors bid item price for mobilization is equal to or less than ten percent num of the total original contract amount less mobilization the department will pay the contractor using the following procedure num .
if the contractor has performed work representing less than five percent num of the total original contract amount less mobilization the department will pay num of the mobilization bid amount num .
if the contractor has performed work representing from five percent num to less than ten percent num of the total original contract amount less mobilization the department will pay num of the bid item price for mobilization and num .
if the contractor has performed work representing ten percent num or more of the total original contract amount less mobilization the department will pay num of the bid item price for mobilization .
if the contractors bid item price for mobilization is greater than ten percent num of the total original contract amount less mobilization the department will only apply the previous payment procedure to that portion of the contractors bid item price for mobilization equal to ten percent num of the total original contract amount less mobilization .
the department will pay the contractor the remainder of the bid item price for mobilization upon completion of the work .

if the field office is a permanent building ensure it is in accordance with the ubc the uniform plumbing code the uniform mechanical code and the nec .
make sure the field office has convenient access to the highway and is located within reasonable distance of the project .
locate the field office site where telephone and cellular service is available .
make sure the field office is clean with electrical outlets and other accessories and appliances in good working order .
make repairs to the field office as necessary .
make sure the field office has sufficient parking for at least num vehicles .
keep the parking areas free of mud snow and debris .
section num field laboratories and field offices page num enclose the field office and parking lot with a chainlink security fence at least six num ft high .
make sure the fence has an access opening at least num ft wide and one num or more chainlink gates at least six num ft in height at an appropriate location to allow vehicles to pass .
provide the fence and gates with at least two num strands of barbed wire and security appurtenances at the top .
num field office architectural requirements make sure the field office has at least num ft num of floor area .
provide the field office with a minimum of num ft num of shelf space .
equip the field office with num .
at least one num closet with at least ten num ft num of floor space and with a num inches wide door with lock and num .
at least one num closet with at least num ft num of floor space and num ft num of shelf space .
provide the field office with at least two num office spaces separate from the rest of the field office by full partition and door .
ensure that these office spaces have at least num ft num of floor space each .
ensure that the field office has sufficient overhead lighting so it requires no additional lighting .
ensure that the field office has num gauge hollow core steel doors with num gauge steel casings on the exterior entrances .
ensure that the field office has num inch nine num gauge smoothexpanded metal grating to cover the windows for security purposes .
weld the metal grating to an angle iron frame .
bolt the whole unit through the wall to an interior metal frame .
ensure that the grating opens or can easily be removed from the interior to comply with fire safety codes .
cover the floors with suitable floor covering such as linoleum or carpeting .
ensure that blinds or curtains cover the windows and that the walls are finished .
num field office hvac requirements equip the field office with an hvac system that can maintain a temperature of at least num f during cold weather and less than num f during hot weather .

one num water cooler num .
one num six num gal minimum capacity water heater num .
a bathroom with lavatory and water closet num .
one drafting table num .
one num worktable measuring approximately num inches x num inches num .
two num chairs and num .
facsimile machine .

a potable water supply section num field laboratories and field offices page num num .
adequate electrical power num .
other utilities required to operate the office num .
a system for wastewater disposal in accordance with state and local requirements .
install devices necessary to protect electronic equipment from power surges in the main power supply and communication lines .
equip the field office with telephone modular jacks in each separate work area and provide an external telephone demarcation point .
install a security light on the exterior portion of the field office near each exterior door .
num release of field office the department will retain possession of the field office for num days after the final inspection or until released by the project manager whichever occurs first .

num materials provide class a concrete in accordance with section num portland cement concrete .
provide reinforcing steel in accordance with section num steel reinforcement .
provide structural steel in accordance with section num steel structures .

provide precast units in accordance with section num precast concrete structures .

precast the drop inlets and junction boxes or cast in place .
raise the existing drop inlets by removing and reconstructing the top six num inches of the existing structure .
reuse the existing grate but provide a new frame .

replace unstable material with structurally adequate material before constructing new foundations .

section num wire mesh for slope stabilization page num section num wire mesh for slope stabilization num description this work consists of roadway slope stabilization to restrain and channel rockfall .
num materials num anchor cable provide anchor cable with a diameter of at least num inch .
it shall be zinccoated steel wire strand common grade type num coating in accordance with astm a num .
num resingrouted steel bolt systems provide a resingrouted steel bolt system with the best standard products of a manufacturer regularly engaged in the production of this type of installation and of the manufacturers latest approved design .
use resingrouted steel bolts and hooked anchors with a minimum diameter of num inch .
use the headed type with flash forging .
use steel bolts with the following tensile properties num .
minimum yield strength num psi num .
minimum ultimate strength num psi use steel bolts and hooked anchors manufactured from any of the grades of deformed bars specified in astm a num .
use steel bolts and hooked anchors specifically designed for resin grouting with lugs vertical ribs and deformations to provide thorough mixing of the resin and to center the steel bolts in the drilled holes .
num resin cartridges provide the type of resin cartridges used in duponts fasloc a resin anchoring system designed for a num inch diameter cartridge in a one num inch diameter hole with a num inch bolt or anchor or provide an approved equal .
num earth anchor systems use earth anchor systems with the best standard products of a manufacturer regularly engaged in the production of this type of installation and of the manufacturers latest approved design .
use earth anchor systems designed for the conditions encountered and as approved by the project manager .
num bearing base plates use bearing base plates that are six num inches square or six num inches diameter round plates in accordance with astm f num .
num certification submit to the project manager for approval any manufacturers certificates literature and shop drawings at least two num weeks before beginning the work .
shop drawings will at a minimum include spacing boltanchor length working load and minimum required torque .
num slope stabilization wire and wire mesh provide tie wire and wire mesh in accordance with section num slope and erosion protection structures .
num polyvinyl chloride coated wire mesh section num wire mesh for slope stabilization page num in addition to section num slope and erosion protection structures use pvccoated wire mesh and connections in accordance with the following num .
extrude the pvc coating onto the wire core before weaving the coated wire num .
overall minimum diameter galvanized wire core plus pvc coating is num inch num .
edging wire will be a galvanized wire core with a diameter of at least num inch approximate u.s. gauge num coated with pvc and having a minimum overall diameter of num inch and num .
lacing wire will be a galvanized wire core with a diameter of at least num inch approximate u.s. gauge num coated with pvc and having a minimum overall diameter of num inch .
num pvc coating provide protective pvc coating that resists the damaging effects of natural weather exposure or immersion in salt water and that does not show any material difference in its initial compound properties in accordance with table num pvc coating physical property requirements .
table num pvc coating physical property requirements property required value test method initial property requirements specific gravity kgdm num num astm d num durometer hardness num astm d num shore d iso num volatile loss maximum astm d num num c for num h two percent numiso num num c for num h six percent num astm d num tensile strength kgcm num minimum num astm d num elongation num astm d num modulus of elasticity kgcm num minimum num of elongation num astm d num resistance to abrasion gm maximum num astm d num numa brittleness temperature c maximum num bs numa cold bend temperature num bs numb cold flex temperature creeping corrosion mm maximum a num apenetration of corrosion of the wire core from a square cut end when the specimen has been immersed for num h in a num solution of hydrochloric acid num be .
num construction requirements prepare top and bottom of slopes by trenching .
scale slope faces in accordance with section num scaling of rock slopes before installing steel boltsanchors and draping and anchoring the wire mesh .
num anchor hole preparation drill bore holes for steel boltsanchors approximately perpendicular to the rock face except in areas approved by the project manager incline the boreholes to a maximum of num section num wire mesh for slope stabilization page num off the perpendicular in order to intercept and seat the steel boltsanchors in solid rock .
upon completion of drilling blow the drilled holes clean with compressed air with an operating air pressure of at least num psi introduced at the back of the hole .
use the manufacturers recommended hole diameter for the steel boltsanchors .
ensure that the clearance between the steel boltanchor and borehole wall is from num inch to num inch .
num anchor installation carefully follow the manufacturers recommended installation procedures for steel boltsanchors .
during construction the contractor may reduce the centertocenter spacing in order to maximize anchorage by selective boltinganchoring in sound rock or to eliminate large voids between the wire mesh and the slope face .
use steel boltshooked anchors that are at least six num feet long .
ensure that the steel bolts extend at least one num foot into sound rock .
as construction progresses the rock conditions encountered may require the lengths of the steel boltshooked anchors to be greater than the minimum length so the project manager may direct varied lengths .
if using varied lengths the department will allow the contractor to use steel couplings or other methods recommended by the manufacturer .
num tensioning and testing of steel bolts and earth anchors tension steel bolts and earth anchors in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
use a minimum torque of num lbfft unless otherwise specified .
after installation test a randomly selected set of ten percent num of the bolts or anchors to confirm the specified working load .
if more than one third of these fail test all boltsanchors .
after replacing the failed bolts and anchors test another randomly selected set of ten percent num of bolts and anchors not including those previously tested and accepted .
repeat the procedure until obtaining the satisfactory results .
replace unacceptable bolts and anchors at no additional cost to the department .
num installation of wire mesh if the contract specifies use pvccoated wire mesh .
lap the wire mesh at least six num inches and securely bind the perimeter edges of wire mesh so that the joints formed by tying the selvedges have a minimum strength equal to that of the body of the mesh .
space ties connectors locking clips or hog rings used for fastening edges four num inches apart or less .
the contractor may lace perimeter edges with binding wire by tightly looping it through every mesh opening .
extend wire mesh down the face of the slope and anchor it to the face of the slope by resingrouted steel bolts or anchors as required .
hold wire mesh in place by the bearing base plates to stretch it to the maximum and contour it to the existing surface .
section num wire mesh for slope stabilization page num anchor the wire mesh at the bottom to contain loose debris and allow periodic maintenance and debris removal .
num alternate anchoring method if specified in the contract anchor wire mesh using anchor cable and hooked resin grouted steel or earth anchors .
num site maintenance maintain the project area and keep it clear of falling rock and debris during construction and at project completion .
dispose of waste and debris at locations approved by the project manager .
num method of measurementreserved num basis of payment pay item pay unit slope protection wire mesh square yard slope protection wire mesh pvccoated square yard resingrouted steel bolts linear foot resingrouted steel anchors linear foot earth anchors linear foot anchor cable linear foot num work included in payment the following work and items will be considered as included in the payment for the main items and will not be measured or paid for separately a. trenching at the top and bottom of the slope b. hauling and disposal of rocks and debris and c. ties lacing wire clips hog rings plates and other appurtenances .
section num scaling of rock slopes page num section num scaling of rock slopes num description this work consists of removing loose rock on the slope using hand scaling hydraulic splitters or blast trimming .
num materialreserved num construction requirements num work plan submit a detailed work plan for each rock slope scaling location to the project manager for approval by the state geotechnical engineer .
submit the plan to the department at least num days before beginning the rock scaling work .
include the following in the plan num .
the proposed construction sequence and schedule num .
the number of rock slope scaling crews to be employed on the project num .
a blasting plan for rock blocks requiring light blasting or trimming and num .
a rock removal and disposal plan for rock debris generated from the rock slope scaling work including provisions to protect adjacent facilities .
num general do not use heavy power equipment such as backhoes on the slope unless otherwise approved by the project manager .
num sequence of operations begin rock slope scaling at the top of the slope and proceed downward removing loose rock as the work progresses .
after completing the first rockslope scaling pass remove rock fragments or debris that hang up on the slopes during the scaling operations .
the project manager will inspect the new face to determine the adequacy of the scaling operation .
num blasting requirements blast in accordance with section num blasting requirements .
ensure that the blasting explosive force is sufficient to remove the loose rock without damaging the surrounding competent rock .
load the drill holes with a sufficient amount of explosive to break the rock between the drill holes without damaging the new face .
num debris removal dispose of the rock and debris resulting from rock slope scaling operations at a location approved by the project manager .
num method of measurementreserved num basis of payment section num scaling of rock slopes page num pay item pay unit scaling of rock slopes square yard num work included in payment hauling and disposal of the rock and debris blasting protection of facilities and work plan will be considered as included in the payment for the scaling of rock slopes and no separate measurement and payment will be made .
section num glare shields page num section num glare shields num description this work consists of providing and installing glare shields .
num materials provide new material for permanent installations or likenew material for temporary installations .
provide glare shields from the departments approved products list .
obtain project manager approval of likenew glare shielding systems for temporary installations before installation .
num mounting system use a mounting system with an approved steel mechanical anchor bolting system .
ensure that each anchor has a minimum num lb pullout and shear strength .
num multiple glare shield blade systems for multiple glare shield blade systems flush mount and internally thread the anchors to allow for removal and replacement of the base rail without damage to the anchors .
use a base rail made of a corrosionresistant material or protected with a rustinhibiting coating .
num glare shield blades provide glare shield blades in accordance with the following requirements num .
use blades of a durable impactresistant nonwarping and nonmetallic material num .
the blade material will not deviate more than num in the tensile strength and elongation values evident at num f if tested at num f and num f in accordance with astm d num num .
the blade material will not deviate more than num in the tensile strength and elongation values evident at num f after num h exposure if tested in accordance with astm d num and astm g num .
num .
the blade color shall be as approved by the department .
num construction requirements place four num inch num inch type iii reflective sheeting yellow or white as appropriate on the blades at num ft intervals .
num glare shield blade spacing space glare shield blades at intervals that will block the light within the glare zone defined as the zone num left and right from the axis of headlight .
make the spacing uniform and uninterrupted for the entire length of the installation .
num base rail construction requirements ensure that base rails for multiple glare shield blade systems fit within the top edge of the concrete wall barrier or form around the edge in a manner that fits tightly against the concrete wall barrier .
section num glare shields page num ensure that each base rail is a continuous single unit spanning the length of the concrete wall barrier unit .
do not span joints between concrete wall barrier sections with the base rail units of multiple glare shield blade systems .
secure each ten num foot baserail unit to the concrete wall barrier with at least three num anchor points unless the project manager or the manufacturer requires more anchors .
num bladetobase rail mounting requirements mount the glare shield blades to the base rail by a bracket assembly that allows the replacement of individual blades .
ensure that the bracket assembly holds the blade rigidly in a fixed position and is adjustable allowing the blades to be switched for traffic passing lefttoleft or righttoright .
num repair of inadequate glare shielding replace anchors that show inadequate bonding with the concrete wall barrier .
replace incorrectly placed glare shield blades .
incorrect placement of a glare shield blade includes the following num .
the blades have an incorrect skew angle num .
the blades are not vertically erect num .
the blades have nonuniform spacing or num .
the anchors are loose .
the project manager will determine which items need to be repaired or replaced .
perform the replacement or repair of inadequate glare shielding at no additional cost to the department .

section num rumble strips page num section num rumble strips num description this work consists of milling rumble strips into roadway shoulders .
num materials num equipment use a device to mill the roadway shoulders that is capable of producing rumble strips in accordance with the contract .
obtain project manager approval of the milling device .
num alignment control use devices equipped with a guide in order to obtain proper alignment of the completed rumble strip .
num construction requirements num general make clearly incised grooves for the rumble strips in accordance with the contract .
place rumble strips in accordance with the plans .
remove or obliterate the rumble strips placed at locations other than shown on the plans and restore the pavement to the satisfaction of the project manager .
num placement allow the hma material to cure for a minimum of num h after compaction before starting rumble strip work .
mill the rumble strips with one num pass of the milling device .
seal all rumble strip surfaces including vertical surfaces with asphalt material .
num method of measurement the department will measure the rumble strips longitudinally parallel to the traveled way for each side of the roadway the contractor installs the rumble strips .
the department will measure rumble strips beginning at the transverse center of the first milled strip and proceeding along the centerline of the rumble strip pattern to the transverse center of the final milled strip in the pattern including breaks that are part of the rumble strip pattern .
the department will not include in the measurement breaks in the rumble strip pattern for exits principal intersections and other interruptions .
num basis of payment pay item pay unit rumble strips linear foot num work included in payment the following work and items will be considered as included in the payment for the main items and will not be measured or paid for separately equipment and labor repair of incorrectly placed rumble strips continuous application of seal coat to completed rumble strips and repair of damaged pavement .
section num revegetation page num section num revegetation num description this work consists of preparing the soil and seeding areas stripped of vegetation during construction operations and required to be revegetated as per the clean water act .
num materials provide certifications for all materials to the project manager before work commences .
num seed the revegetationerosion control plans will specify the species varieties or origins and rates of seeding .
the contract will specify varieties of certified weedfree seed in accordance with new mexico seed law nmsa num num et seq ..
the revegetationerosion control plan will specify the minimum standards for each species .
provide certified seed of named varieties in accordance with the minimum standards of the appropriate seed certification agency .
num labeling and certification seal and label each bag of seed in accordance with the federal seed act num u.s.c .
num et seq .
and nmda seed labeling requirements nmsa num num .
provide the following information on each bag tag for each species num .
variety specify if certified num .
kind of seed num .
lot number num .
purity num .
germination num .
percentage crop seed percentage inert percentage noxious weeds in accordance with new mexico seed law nmsa num num et seq .
num .
origin num .
test date and num .
weight in pounds of this species or percentage of total lot .
provide seed analysis results that are not older than num months .
provide to the project manager documentation of seed origin and pure live seed content from a certified testing laboratory .
seed must arrive in the original sealed containers from the certified supplier and the revegetation contractor must provide all tags and certifications to the project manager .
certification must be provided that the seed has been stored in appropriate conditions in the num months before arriving at the project .
any seed substitutions require letters from three num sources confirming that the originally specified seed is not available at the time of installation .
each seed bad shall have a unique identification number and the certified seed supplier shall maintain records of seed bad identification numbers for a period of three num years .
calculate the pure live seed using the following equation num g p pls num where section num revegetation page num pls is the pure live seed p is the percent purity g is the percent germination including dormant seed the contractor may provide premixed seeds .
provide documentation as if the supplier sold or bagged the seeds separately .
num amendments provide amendments specified type and formulation and suppliers certification in accordance with the contract .
num wood chip mulch provide certified weedfree core material woodchips .
the material must be num untreated wood chips and free of inorganic debris such as plastic glass metal etc .
manufacturer shall certify that the material is free of noxious weeds .
woodchip size shall not be smaller than one num inch and shall not exceed three num inches in diameter shavings shall not be more than five precent num of the total mass .
num hay mulch use perennial native or introduced grasses of finestemmed varieties unless otherwise specified in the contract .
provide bales of hay containing at least num by weight ten num inch herbage or longer .
the department will not accept rotten brittle or moldy hay or hay containing noxious seed or plants .
the contractor may provide marsh grass or prairie hay composed of native grass of specified species .
the department will accept tall wheat grass intermediate wheat grass switch grass or orchard hay if the contractor cuts it before seed formation .
use marsh grass hay composed of mid and tall native usually tough and wiry grass and grasslike plants found in the lowland areas of the rocky mountain region .
cure and harvest hay at least num days before use .
all hay mulch is to be free of noxious weeds as certified by an industry recognized forage certification authority .
num straw mulch do not use rotten or moldy straw .
all straw mulch is to be free of noxious weeds as certified by an industry recognized forage certification authority .
num wood cellulose mulch provide wood cellulose mulch that consists of a specially prepared virgin wood fiber processed to contain no growthinhibiting or germinationinhibiting factors .
manufacture and process mulch so the wood cellulose fibers remain in uniform suspension in water under agitation and will blend with grass seed fertilizer and other additives to form a homogenous slurry .
provide processed mulch materials with the following characteristics num .
can form a blotterlike ground cover on application num .
has moisture and percolation properties and num .
can cover and hold grass seed in contact with the soil .
section num revegetation page num num bonded fiber matrix bfm bonded fiber matrix bfm is a hydraulically applied blanket that controls soil erosion and accelerates seed germination .
bfm is a threedimensional composite of wood or paper fibers bonded by polymer tackifiers that provides high performance erosion prevention on slopes .
a submittal shall be provided to the project manager providing coredrill photographs indicating the depth of completed bfm on the a soil horizon .
the submittal shall reflect the tonnage of bfm required per acre on the project .
the project manager shall use this to confirm correct coverage of bfm on the project .
num composted mulch furnish and place composted mulch as shown on the plans and in accordance with the criteria as described below .
composted mulch provider must be registered with or permitted by the new mexico environment department solid waste bureau and must be in compliance with num nmac num .
the standard specified one num inch of compost mulch tilled into the top four num inches of soil for class a seeding equals num cubic yards of mulch per acre .
composted mulch is defined as the product of a controlled aerobic thermophilic biological decomposition process that meets the quality requirements in table num quality requirements for composted mulch .
raw materials used in producing composted mulch may include green waste animal manure animal bedding paper waste food waste biosolids or other nontoxic organic matter but shall not include animal mortalities .
table num material and operations for classes of seeding material measure method criterion all composted mulches moisture content evaporative loss at numc no more than num particle size sieve num to num of material passes ¾ inch screen num of pieces smaller than num inches in length and num inches in diameter electrical conductivity num slurry mass basis num mmhocm ph num slurry mass basis ph num ph num organic matter loss on ignition at numc num num of dry weight maturity minimum num germination to second set of leaves for marigold seeds in num volume basis mixture of ¾ inch screened composted mulch and twicerinsed nursery sand .
stability maximum core temperature of numf after num hours in num foot tall conical pile with moisture adjusted to between num and num .
debris less than one percent num inorganic debris by volume including but not limited to glass plastic stones and metal .
composted mulches with wastewater biosolids trace metals hnonum digestion complies with table num of numcfrnum fecal coliforms mpn with anum broth num mpndry gram tests marked with asterisks must be performed by a suitable analytical laboratory other tests may be performed by the composted mulch producer .
section num revegetation page num num acceptance before delivering composted mulch provider shall furnish documentation that includes the following num .
the raw materials by percentage used in the production of the delivered composted mulch num .

an affidavit signed by a responsible company representative confirming that the composted mulch meets each requirement shown in table num quality requirements for composted mulch .
the project manager or landscape architect may inspect and approve the composted mulch application during installation and upon completion of the project .
certification of compost weight shall be required .
the weight shall account for moisture content at the time of sale .
certification must indicate date and time of sale source of compost and delivery location .
num rock mulch rock mulch shall be ¾ inch to one num inch diameter fractured face material installed over hydroseeded areas to a depth of one num inch thick to aid in erosion control and water harvesting .
the finished rock mulch surface must be smooth and uniform maintaining the original flow lines slope gradients and contours of the job .
certification of quantities must be provided to the project manager .
a sample of the proposed rock mulch must be provided to the project manager and landscape architect for approval before application .
a submittal shall be provided from a rock mulch supplier confirming the tonnage required per acre for one num inch thickness of coverage depending on the chosen rock type size .
num construction requirements num sampling the department may sample and test shipments of seed and fertilizer for compliance with the regulations and requirements of the nmda .
the department may reject seed or fertilizer not in accordance with the contract .
num seeding classes provide the various classes and the material and operations for each class in accordance with table num material and operations for classes of seeding .
table num material and operations for classes of seeding operation seeding class a c d ss seed bed preparation x x x amendments seeding chain harrowing or hand raking x x x x x x x x x x x compost mulch x x hay or straw anchoring crimping x a hay or straw anchoring tack x a x section num revegetation page num soil retention blanket x bfm x x aanchoring method is based on the specified mulch type .
key x required not required the department defines the seeding classes as follows num .
class a seeding with a drill slopes flatter than num num .
class c seeding with hydroseeder soil preparation bfm slopes flatter than num num .
class d seeding with soil retention blanket num .
class ss steep slope or inaccessible area seeding with a hydroseeder bfm num seedbed preparation till the seedbed with a disc harrow or chiseling tools to at least four num inches deep .
uproot competitive vegetation during seedbed preparation and uniformly work the soil to a surface free of clods large stones or other deleterious material that would interfere with seeding equipment .
add any soil amendments as specified by disc harrow or chisel to a depth of four num inches .
till across the slope if practical .
do not till the seedbed if the moisture content of the soil is outside the limits recommended by the seed supplier for planting or the ground is in a non tillable condition .
do not prepare more seedbed area on which the entire seeding operation can be applied before the surface crusts or loses seed and fertilizer to erosion .
if erosion or crusting occurs perform seedbed preparation again .
num amendments apply the specified amendment uniformly to the prepared seedbed .
num seeding season limitations there are no restrictions on time of seeding other than that the ground may not be frozen .
cool season grasses have been added to all seeding recommendations .
num seeding operations uniformly apply the seed mix at a rate in accordance with the contract .
if practical perform the seeding operations across the slope by drilling .
do not drive vehicles or other equipment on seeded areas .
if rainfall or some other factor prevents the contractor from seeding to the specified depth on prepared surfaces the contractor shall prepare the seedbed and apply seed again at no additional cost to the department .
num drill seeding plant seed approximately num inch deep with a maximum depth of one num inch unless otherwise specified in the contract .
ensure that the distance between the drilled furrows is no more than eight num inches .
if the furrow openers on the drill exceed eight num inches redrill section num revegetation page num the area .
perform seeding with grass seeding equipment in good working order .
ensure that the equipment has the following num .
double disc openers num .
depth bands num .
drop tubes num .
packer wheels or drag chains num .
rate control attachments num .
seed boxers with agitators for trashy seed .
num contractors responsibility for seeded areas protect and care for seeded areas until final acceptance of the work .
repair any damage to seeded areas caused by pedestrian or vehicular traffic at no additional cost to the department .
num contractors warranty of work a num day inspection of mulch following completion of application of mulch with mechanical crimping and tackifer must indicate a minimum of num of the original mulch still in place .
areas not meeting this criterion must be remulched and tackifier applied to meet the num standard .
allowance will be made for exceptional wind or water events which may have occurred during the num day time period .
num mulching do not perform mulching when wind velocity exceeds num mph .
ensure that hay and straw mulch have at least num of fibers exceeding ten num inches long on the ground after application .
spread the mulch uniformly over the area either by hand or with a mechanical mulch spreader .
if spreading by hand tear apart the bales of mulch and fluff it before spreading .
spread mulch for seeding with a mechanical mulch spreader .
anchor or tack the mulch with an approved tackifier .
use the materials and rate of application recommended by the manufacturer .
the tackifier shall be incidental to the seeding .
perform mechanical mulch anchoring with a tackifier when the mechanical method is impractical due to steep slopes or rocky areas and when approved by the project manager .
num hay mulch ensure that the rate of application of hay mulch is at least two num tons per acre of airdry hay .
anchor hay mulch using a crimper with flat serrated discs at least one num inch thick with dull edges spaced no more than nine num inches apart .
ensure that the disc diameter is large enough to prevent the frame of the equipment from dragging in mulch .
ensure that hay mulch anchoring is at least two num inches deep and do not cover it with excessive amounts of soil .
perform hay mulch anchoring across the slope where practical with no more than two num passes of the anchoring equipment .
num straw mulch section num revegetation page num ensure that the straw mulch rate of application is at least two num tons per acre of airdry straw .
anchor straw mulch with an approved tackifier at the rate of application recommended by the manufacturer .
num wood cellulose mulch apply wood cellulose mulch uniformly at the approved rate .
num method of measurement the department will measure parallel to slopes .

section num excavation trenching and backfilling for utilities page num section num excavation trenching and backfilling for utilities num description this work consists of performing excavation trenching and backfilling for underground utility lines .
num materialsreserved num construction requirements num trenching and excavation grades for underground utility lines are the invert inside bottom of the pipe unless the contract specifies otherwise .
during excavation pile material suitable for backfill in an orderly manner far enough away from the banks of the trench to avoid overloading and to prevent slides or caveins .
perform grading necessary to prevent surface water from flowing into trenches or other excavations remove water that has accumulated by pumping or with other approved methods .
perform trenching far enough in advance of pipe laying to allow the project manager to make necessary grade changes .
unless otherwise specified in the contract begin backfilling immediately after laying pipe and keep pace with pipelaying operations .
num trench widths ensure that trenches are wide enough to properly lay align grade and joint the pipe .
dig trenches to at least num inches wide but in no case should they exceed num times the outside diameter of the pipe plus num inches plus twice the thickness of shoring structures at the level of the top of the pipe .
the contractor may use excavation for concrete structures as the outside form if approved by the project manager .
if trenching is behind a curb in lawns or adjacent to sidewalks or walls ensure that the trench is not wider than the outside diameter of the pipe plus num inches at the trench top .
provide sheeting or bracing as necessary .
the department will consider over depth excavation not ordered by the project manager as unauthorized .
fill the unauthorized excavation with granular or compacted embedment material or concrete as directed by the project manager at no additional cost to the department .
num shaping trench bottoms accurately grade trench bottoms for pipe six num inches or smaller to provide uniform bearing and support throughout the length of each section of pipe .
finish the bottom of the trench by excavating a shallow concave groove at the line of the pipe and shape it approximately to fit the pipe .
excavate trench bottoms for larger pipe to below the grade line as necessary to allow the installation of granular embedment foundation material for the pipe .
dig bell holes and depressions for joints after grading the trench bottom so that the full length of the pipe rests on the prepared bottom .
make these depressions the length depth and width necessary to properly fit the particular type of joint .
do not excavate below the specified final trench bottom elevation unless the contract section num excavation trenching and backfilling for utilities page num requires granular embedment foundation material .
num foundations remove wet or otherwise unstable soil incapable of properly supporting the pipe and backfill the trench to grade with granular embedment foundation material or other suitable material .
if the contractor excavates deeper than the specified grade the contractor shall backfill the trench to grade with granular embedment foundation material or other approved material .
thoroughly tamp the replacement foundation material to provide a solid bed for the pipe .
the project manager will determine if material from the trench is acceptable .
num rock excavation remove rock that is not rippable with a rip tooth or that occurs in masses larger than num yd num or ledges at least four num inches thick in accordance with section num excavation borrow and embankment .
if the contractor encounters solid rock during excavation the contractor shall excavate to a depth six num inches below the outside bottom of the pipe and backfill the trench to the proper grade .
if materials can not be handled or compacted as earth including rock the contractor shall separate them from excavated materials that the contractor shall use as fill or embankment material .
dispose of rock separated from fill material as approved by the project manager .
num wet excavation requirements keep trenches and other excavations free of water by bailing pumping or draining during construction operations .
keep water away from concrete or cement joints until the materials attain initial set .
provide the following as necessary num .
cofferdams num .
pumps num .
drains num .
ditches num .
well points and num .
other means for removing water from the excavations or other parts of the work and for preventing excavated slopes from sliding or caving .
dewater for at least num h in the vicinity of concrete to allow the concrete to set properly .
dispose of water by pumping it into ditches storm drains or sanitary sewers in accordance with applicable regulations .
num bracing and sheeting the department will allow the contractor to cut trench banks on slopes to prevent sliding and caving where the increased trench width will not interfere with surface features or encroach on right of way limits .
slopes may not intersect vertical trench walls more than num inches above the top of pipe .
do not remove sheeting and bracing until sufficient backfill is in place to protect the utility structures and the adjacent roadway from caving damage .
section num excavation trenching and backfilling for utilities page num leave sheeting in place if necessary and approved in writing by the project manager .
cut off sheeting left in place at least one num ft below the ground surface .
num bedding and backfill provide bedding and backfill for utilities in accordance with section num nmsspwc appurtenant stipulations except provide compaction within four num ft of pipe and utility appurtenances under the roadway prism to num of maximum dry density as determined by aashto t num modified proctor method d ttcp modified .
if backfilling uncased pipe do not break chip crush crack or otherwise damage the pipe .
backfill polyvinyl chloride pipe only if the pipe is num f or below .
num backfill material provide backfill material that after placement and compaction is capable of supporting the design loads .
provide backfill material that is free of lumps debris other deleterious materials and sharp rocks stones or other objects that might damage the pipe .
num backfill compaction operations compact backfill material placed around irregular areas with handoperated tamping equipment .
compact anchor loads for pipe testing and other backfill placed before the regular trench backfill .
num contractors responsibility for protection of public utilities repair damage to structures pipelines conduits cables sewers storm drains or other utilities encountered in or adjacent to the excavation due to the contractors negligence .
use reasonable measures and precautions including blue stake or one call to protect utilities .
locate underground utilities before excavating and provide support to protect these utilities and avoid damage or interruption in functions .
at least seven num days before beginning excavation provide written notification to owners of public utilities that may be affected by construction so that the owners may make necessary arrangements .
restore or rebuild property damaged by construction operations to at least the condition that existed before the construction operations .
get the project managers approval to relocate trench lines to avoid known obstacles .
permanently plug the dead ends left in the trench from removed abandoned pipes conduits or sewers .
num house service connections do not disturb or damage existing house lateral connections to utility mains .
replace broken lateral connections with the same type pipe or better at no additional cost to the department .
num method of measurementreserved num basis of payment the department will pay for authorized rock excavation in accordance with section num excavation borrow and embankment .
the department will pay for sheeting left in place at the direction of the project manager section num excavation trenching and backfilling for utilities page num at an agreed price that does not exceed the actual material cost .
section num manholes page num section num manholes num description this work consists of constructing manholes .
construct manholes complete with covers steps fittings and other appurtenances .

num nmsspwc appurtenant stipulations adhere to the applicable requirements of the nmsspwc except for the procedures for method of measurement and basis of payment .
num terms substitute engineer as it appears in the applicable sections of the nmsspwc with project manager .
the term owner refers to the entity owning the affected utilities on this project .
num manhole types use precast concrete sections to construct drop and standard manholes .
the department defines drop manholes as manholes that have outside pipe and fittings for dropping sewage into the lower line .
the department defines standard manholes as inside drop manholes where the incoming line discharges directly into the manhole and does not require special fittings .
num materials num general use new materials of the best standard quality available for the intended purpose .
the contractor may substitute contract specified brand name materials with generic materials of equal quality if the contractor provides adequate technical and descriptive data and the project manager approves .

num placement requirements use mortar within num min after mixing .

num pipe assembling perform the following before pipe assembly num .
clean off dirt and pipe scale num .
ream and remove burrs and num .
clear pipes and fittings of dirt dust and moisture .
use manufacturerrecommended fittings to ensure leakproof joints .
use elastomeric sealed joints in accordance with astm f num and astm d num .
clean the interior of pipes from foreign matter before lowering into the trench and keep them clean during installation using plugs or other methods approved by the project manager .
num pipe placement section num utility items page num lay pipes in accordance with these standard specifications and the manufacturers recommendations .
ensure that the full length of each section of pipe rests solidly on the pipe bed including recesses to accommodate the joints .
if a pipe section is disturbed after initial installation remove and relay .
do not lay pipes in water or unsuitable weather conditions .
when not working on pipes securely close open ends of pipes and fittings to prevent trench water earth or other deleterious material from entering them .
num pressurized pipe tests thoroughly flush out main line supply pipelines and test them for leaks before placing backfill and installing valves .
firmly block the fittings at bends in the pipelines and at the ends of lines to prevent the fittings from blowing off the lines when under pressure .
ensure that fittings and couplings are visible for inspection during the entire test period .
test in accordance with nmsspwc .

section num landscape planting page num section num landscape planting num description this work consists of providing trees shrubs and other materials necessary to complete the landscape .
this work includes labor equipment and the performance of operations including planting fertilizing watering cleanup of planting areas and replacement of unsatisfactory damaged and unacceptable planting materials .
num materials num plant materials provide healthy vigorous plants of the type species and variety and size specified .
provide plants with normal welldeveloped branch and root systems .
ensure plants are free of the following num .
damage from machines num .
sun or frost damage num .
insects and insect eggs and num .
disfiguring knots or other objectionable defects .
provide plants that equal or exceed the minimum specified measurements .
select plant materials for shape and branching habit that will produce the strong full foliage of a typical mature specimen .
num inspection of plant materials provide plant materials in accordance with state and federal laws including the new mexico plant protection act nmsa num num et seq .
for disease infestation inspection .
inspection certificates required by law must accompany each shipment invoice or order of stock .
on delivery provide the certificate to the project manager .
provide for department inspection at the place of origin or in a local nursery and upon delivery to the planting location at the project .
num notification and inspection submit an itemized list of the plants to the project manager along with a time and location the inspection may be made at least seven num days in advance .
the landscape architect and the project manager will make plant inspections jointly .
the project manager will tag the accepted plants before plants are removed from the nursery for delivery to the project .
the project manager and the landscape architect will inspect for size vigor representation of the species and variety damage condition of ball and roots and latent defects .
num container plants provide plants specified on the plant list as container grown at a reasonable stage of development for the specified container size .
provide plants grown in their containers long enough to develop good round root systems capable of holding the soil intact after removal from the container but not enough to become root bound .
num substitutions section num landscape planting page num the department will permit substitutions of equivalent varieties of plant materials or other materials only after the contractor makes every reasonable effort to secure materials of the species varieties and kinds listed on the bid forms or in the contract .
submit requests for substitutions in writing to the project manager for approval by the landscape architect .
obtain written approval from the project manager before substituting the materials .
num delivery of shipment to site protect plant materials before shipment to prevent damage overdrying or wind .
be careful when digging wrapping and binding plants to ensure safe loading shipment and handling of heavy balled plants .
notify the project manager of the time and manner of delivery at least seven num days in advance .
provide two num copies of an itemized list of the quantities of plant materials in each delivery with the notice .
the project manager will inspect the plants upon delivery .
the department will reject cracked or mushroomed balls and damaged plants that are unacceptable for planting .
immediately remove rejected plants from the project .
num tagging and labeling of plant materials securely tag plants with legible durable labels using weatherresistant ink and identifying the following for each plant num .
origin num .
species num .
variety num .
name and num .
size .
keep tags on through final inspection .
num fertilizer provide fertilizer in accordance with the contract .
num water use clean water that is free from pollutants harmful to plant growth or that could contaminate the environment .
num construction requirements num planting use the planting backfill mixture and provide watering basins in accordance with contract .
do not plant deeper than the original ground line .
num care and replacement water and maintain the plants for at least one num year from the date of final acceptance unless otherwise approved by the landscape architect .
if the contractor installs a drip irrigation system the contractor shall hand water the plants until the drip irrigation system is in place and operational .
at the direction of the project manager replace dead or unhealthy plants for one num year after the date of final acceptance .
provide replacement plants that are in accordance with the section num landscape planting page num contract .
num final inspection and acceptance after the completion of the landscape planting work the project manager and landscape architect will make final inspection and acceptance .
num method of measurement the department will measure the actual number of trees shrubs or other plants provided planted and accepted .

num decertification of quality control program the department may withdraw approval of a sign manufacturers qc program if the manufacturer fails to follow the certified written qc program or fabricates signs that do not section num traffic signs and sign structures page num conform to department specifications .
the traffic services engineer or designee will determine the decertification period based on the severity and nature of infractions .
the department may prohibit the use of sign manufacturers that do not have a certified qc program .
however the traffic services engineer may allow the sign manufacturer to supply signs under the following conditions when the qc program certification has been withdrawn num .
the sign manufacturer shall hire an itl to inspect the manufacture of signs to be used on department projects as approved by the department and num .
the itl shall have a certified quality control program .
the itl shall provide a checklist in accordance with the certified qc program to the project manager indicating the signs were inspected and in accordance with the specifications .
the traffic services engineer or designee may recertify sign manufacturers if they meet department requirements .

the traffic services section will verify that the proposed sign manufacturer is eligible to supply signs to the project .

num retroreflective sheeting durability and workmanship use retroreflective sheeting material in accordance with astm d num current version .
provide sheeting material sufficiently strong and flexible enough for handling processing and application in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations without stretching .
when processed and applied in accordance with recommended procedures sheeting material must be weather resistant and following cleaning must show no discoloration cracking blistering or dimensional change .
section num traffic signs and sign structures page num when exposed to normal traffic and weather sheeting material must not support fungus growth or accumulate dirt that reduce brightness before cleaning to less than num of the brightness after cleaning measured at num divergence and num incidence .
use a sheeting surface that can be refurbished by cleaning and clear protective overcoating in accordance with manufacturers recommendations .
apply retroreflective sheeting to a treated substrate as recommended by the manufacturer .
ensure finished signs have a smooth and uniform surface and that letters and numbers are cleancut and sharp .
ensure the sheeting surface is solvent resistant and can be cleaned with a soft clean cloth dampened with vm p naphtha or mineral spirits .
num retroreflective sheeting delivery and handling if the contractor provides retroreflective sheeting in continuous rolls the contractor shall ensure splices are smooth with no discernible lines and that sheeting is suitable for continuous application .
use sheeting within the manufacturers recommended time frame .
num multiple pieces of sign sheeting ensure that sign faces from two num or more pieces of retroreflective sheeting match in color and provide uniform appearance and brilliance by day and night .
cover sign panels less than num inches tall with one num unspliced sheet of retroreflective sheeting .
the department will allow a horizontal splice only if the substrate panel is num inches or taller .
ensure sheet colors match .
sheeting shall be butt spliced when more than one num piece of sheeting is used on one num piece of substrate per manufacturers recommendations .
the sheeting pieces should not touch each other .
num screening inks the department will allow use of screening inks or acrylic film overlays recommended by the retroreflective sheeting manufacturer instead of manufactured colors to produce the legend and background .
submit the manufacturers recommendations in writing to the department .
file a copy of the recommendations in accordance with section num sign manufacturers quality control .
use ultraviolet uv resistant inks requiring no additional clear coating or uv protection .
use inks that are one num part nonisocynate material easily removed from sign screens with citrusbased environmentally friendly screen cleaning solvents .
num outdoor weatherability use screening inks or acrylic film overlays with weatherresistant properties equal to retroreflective sheeting .
num adherence to test for screening ink process paste or film overlay adherence apply cellophane tape to a cured color processed area and remove the tape with one num quick motion no ink paste or film overlay should come off .
use num inch wide cellophane tape for this test .
num solvent resistance after curing ensure sign faces resist manufacturer recommended cleaning solvents .
section num traffic signs and sign structures page num num vandal resistance ensure that sign faces resist manufacturer recommended aromatic solvents used to remove paint or other oil based matter sprayed or painted on signs .
num color use a sign face color in accordance with astm d num current version .
num retroreflective intensity transparent colors process and apply transparent colored inks or transparent colored acrylic film overlays in accordance with the sheeting manufacturers recommendations .
ensure that the transparent color area processed on white sheeting provides a minimum retroreflective intensity value of at least num of the values specified in table num type iv sheetingunmetallized microprismatic element table num type viii f sheetingfluorescent microprismatic lens table num type ix sheeting microprismatic lens table num type ix f sheetingfluorescent microprismatic element and table num type xi retroreflective sheeting for each color at num oa and num ea or num andor num observation angles if specified in the contract .
num process colors on sheeting ensure the retroreflective intensity values are num of the retroreflective values specified in section num .
corresponding values at num oa and num ea are included in table num retroreflective intensity per process color .
num process inks ensure that process inks equal num of the coefficient of retroreflection of new sheeting and num at the end of the warranty period .

num sign fabrication for extruded panel signs sign legend and background for extruded panel signs shall be fabricated on a metal facing panel unless a digital printing process is used .
num metal panel fabrication cover extrusiontype signs with a metal facing panel of the same metal as the extrusions .
the flatness tolerance for an installed panel is num inch per foot of length and num inch per inch of width .
for metal facing panels use panel units two num feet to four num feet wide installed vertically .
do not horizontally splice metal facing sign panels eight num ft tall or less .
for horizontal splices on signs taller than eight num feet offset the metal facing splices from the corresponding extrusion joint by num inch to one num inch .
section num traffic signs and sign structures page num for aluminum facing panels use a sheet of aluminum numtnum or numhnum alloy in accordance with astm b num supplied as flat stock material with a minimum thickness of num inch .
num digitally printed signs signs manufactured using digital printing process with a protective overlay film to produce all or part of the image shall conform to all other requirements of section num with the exception that signs may be comprised of extruded panels only or by using metal panel fabrication over the extruded panel .
for extruded panel signs without metal panels all or part of the image shall be printed on the required sheeting which then shall be laminated to the aluminum extrusion .
after lamination of the sheeting to the extrusions the extrusions may be assembled and bolted together to finish the sign .
for metal panel signs all or part of the image may be printed before or after the sheeting is laminated to the metal panel .
num outdoor weathering of digitally printed signs inks applied using digital printing processes with a protective overlay film shall produce standard traffic colors green yellow red blue brown black and have outdoor weathering properties equal to that of the base reflective sheeting .
num standard traffic colors digitally printed standard traffic colors green yellow red blue brown and black printed with digital printing technology with a protective overlay film must provide the diffuse daytime color of the retroreflective sheeting in accordance with astm dnum current version table num .
num retroreflective intensity of digitally printed standard traffic colors the coefficient of retro reflection of the standard traffic colors green yellow red blue brown and black digitally produced on white sheeting shall provide an initial minimum retroreflective intensity as specified in section num .

num flexible traffic markers provide flexible traffic markers that consist of a nonmetallic post with reflective sheeting and a drivable or nondrivable anchor system as applicable .
provide posts for flexible traffic markers fabricated from a flexible nonmetallic material resistant to impact ultraviolet light ozone and hydrocarbon damage and stiffening with age .
provide wellmanufactured posts free from burrs discoloration contamination and other objectionable marks or defects .
use white yellow brown or orange for flexible traffic markers as specified in the contract .
provide flexible traffic marker posts that are flexible throughout the temperature range of from num f to num f and provide an installed height of from num inches to num inches .
use selfrestoring flexible traffic markers remaining serviceable after being subjected to a series of direct impacts by a standard vehicle .
ensure posts and delineators are capable of withstanding five num impacts at any angle at a speed of num mph and ten num impacts at any angle at a speed of num mph .
provide posts designed for a permanent installation to resist overturning twisting and displacement from wind and impact forces .

provide tubular traffic marker bases painted black or the same color as the post .
provide assembly units necessary for the particular marker in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .

the contractor may retain posts with o clips selflocking for posts in holes num inches deep .
the department may accept other direct burial methods after local demonstration of their stability .
provide surface mounted bases with a height of from num inch to two num inch and an outside diameter of from seven num inch to num inch .
provide drivedown bases with the dimensions listed on the departments approved products list .

num sampling testing and acceptance contractors or subcontractors supplying glass beads for use on department projects shall notify the department and make available to the state materials bureau a copy of the shipping invoice and a copy of the manufacturers test results of the lot numbers shipped to the contractor .
upon request the contractor will submit to the state materials bureau two num unopened bags of glass beads per batch or lot number as well as a copy of the above information .
the state materials bureau will obtain a representative sample and test it for specification acceptance by astm d num astm d num and such other tests as designated in these specifications .
upon determination of acceptability or rejection of beads a report covering the lots tested will be issued by the state materials bureau to the contractor .
the contractor shall furnish each project a certificate with reference to the state materials bureau test control number indicating that beads provided to the project have been tested and accepted by the state materials bureau .
verifications of the certification will be made by project personnel checking the lot number on the bags furnished to the project .
no field sampling of beads will be required when the above procedures are followed .

num hot thermoplastic pavement markings the thermoplastic reflectorized material shall consist of a solid mixture of heatstable resins white or yellow pigment intermixed glass beads filler and other materials in granular or block form specifically compounded for reflectorized pavement markings to be applied to the pavement in a molten state .
the characteristics of the liquefied material shall be such that complete and even coverage of specified areas to the required thicknesses is provided by the required application method and rate .
upon cooling to normal pavement temperature this material shall produce an adherent reflectorized marking capable of resisting deformation and wear in the roadway .
num acceptance of hot thermoplastic contractor shall supply a letter of certification from the manufacturer with each batch certifying the material meets the requirements of the nmdots hot thermoplastic pavement markings section num .
test methods all tests shall be performed according to astm aashto federal test method standard number num or methods designated by the state .
the department will reduce payment for or reject hot thermoplastic pavement markings used before submitting the proper documentation if the test results do not meet the specifications .
num general requirements the thermoplastic material shall not exude fumes which are toxic injurious or require specialized breathing apparatus when heated to the temperature range specified by the manufacturer for application .
the material shall remain stable when held for four num hours at this temperature or when subjected to four num reheatings not exceeding a total of four num hours after cooling to ambient temperature .
the temperature viscosity characteristics of the plastic material shall remain constant throughout the reheatings and shall show like characteristics from batch to batch .
there shall be no obvious change in color of the thermoplastic material as a result of reheating and the color of the material shall not vary from batch to batch .

color shall match federal test standard number num color chip no .
num .
yellow daylight reflectance at num degrees num degrees shall be num percent minimum .
color shall match federal test standard number num color chip no .
num .
num retroreflectance the white and yellow thermoplastic materials shall meet the minimum retroreflectance values in accordance with table num as measured by a portable retroreflectometer device within num days after application to the roadway surface .

the specific gravity of the material as determined by section num of aashto t num shall be between num and num .
num impact resistance after heating the thermoplastic material for four num hours five num minutes at num three num degrees f and forming test specimens the impact resistance shall be not less than ten num inchpounds when tested in accordance with section num of aashto t num .
num bond strength after heating the thermoplastic material for four num hours five num minutes at num three num degrees f the bond strength to portland cement concrete shall be not less than num pounds per square inch .
the bond strength shall be determined in accordance with the procedures specified in section num of aashto t num .
num abrasion resistance the abrasion resistance of the thermoplastic material shall be determined by forming a representative lot of the material at a thickness of num inches on a fourinch square monel panel thickness num num inches on which a suitable primer has been previously applied and subjecting it to num revolutions on a taber abraser at num c using hnum calibrated wheels weighted to num grams .
the wearing surface shall be kept wet with distilled water throughout the test .
the maximum loss of thermoplastic material shall be num grams .
num cracking resistance at low temperature after heating the thermoplastic material for four num hours five num minutes at num three num degrees f applying to concrete blocks and cooling to num three num degrees the material shall show no cracks when observed from a distance exceeding num inches .
testing for low temperature crack resistance shall be in accordance with the procedures specified in section num of aashto t num .
num flowability after heating the thermoplastic material for four num hours five num minutes at num three num degrees f and testing for flowability in accordance with section num of aashto t num the white thermoplastic shall have a maximum percent residue of num and the yellow thermoplastic shall have maximum percent residue of num .
num yellowness index the white thermoplastic material shall not exceed a yellowness index of num when tested section num pavement markings page num in accordance with section num of aashto t num .
num flowability extended heating after heating the thermoplastic material for eight num num hours at num three num degrees with stirring the last six num hours and testing for flowability in accordance with section num of aashto t num the thermoplastic shall have a maximum percent residue of num .
num flash point the thermoplastic material shall have a flash point not less than num degrees f when tested in accordance with the requirements of astm d num .
num storage life the materials shall meet the requirements of this specification for a period of one num year from the date of manufacture .
the month and year of manufacture shall be clearly marked on all packages of thermoplastic material .
the thermoplastic material must also melt uniformly with no evidence of skins or unmelted particles for this one num year period .
any material which does not meet the above requirements or which is no longer within this one num year period at the time of application shall not be used .
the contractor shall replace any outdated material with material meeting the above performance and time requirements at no additional cost to the department .
num primersealer primersealers shall be used on portland cement concrete surfaces and existing aged asphalt with exposed aggregate .
primersealer should not be used on new asphalt surfaces .
the primer sealer shall be applied as recommended by the thermoplastic material manufacturer .
the primersealer shall be compounded specifically for use with the specified thermoplastic material .
num color stability using accelerated weathering per astm gnum cycle num white color stability shall be measured for no color change after num hours of exposure and for yellow color shall be measured for no color change after num hours of exposure .
num composition the thermoplastic composition shall conform to the following requirements table num percent by weight white yellow binder num minimum num minimum titanium dioxide for white num minimum yellow lead free pigment for yellow num minimum reflective glass intermix beads num num num num calcium carbonate or equivalent filler num num num num the ingredients of the thermoplastic composition shall be thoroughly mixed and in a solid or sectionalized block or freeflowing granular form .
when heated in a melting apparatus the material shall readily liquefy into a uniform solution .
this solution shall be free from all skins dirt foreign objects or any other ingredient which would cause bleeding staining blotting or discoloration when applied to the bituminous or concrete pavement surfaces .
the thermoplastic shall be based on the following binder composition alkyd shall consist of a mixture of synthetic resins at least one num of which is solid at room temperature and of highboilingpoint plasticizers .
at least one third of the section num pavement markings page num binder composition and no less than eight percent num by weight of the entire material formulation shall be solid maleicmodified glycerol ester resin or maleic modified pentaerythritol ester resin .
the alkyd binder shall not contain any petroleumbased hydrocarbon resins .
an alkyd thermoplastic formulation may be used for symbols legends and transverse lines including stop bars and crosswalks .
an alkyd thermoplastic formulation may be used for longitudinal lines including lane lines and edge lines unless otherwise shown on the project plans or specified herein .
extrusion or spray formulations shall be used in accordance with requirements of the application equipment used to install the markings .
num reflective glass beads the intermix glass beads shall conform to aashto m num type i and may be coated or uncoated as recommended by the manufacturer .
if uncoated beads are used the thermoplastic formulation shall be configured to minimize settling of the inter mix beads when the material is heated and applied .
in addition to incorporating glass beads in the thermoplastic mix glass beads shall be applied to the surface of the molten material immediately after application .
the dropon beads shall be in accordance with new mexico state department of transportation standards and specifications for highway and bridge construction section num and shall be applied at a minimum rate of num pounds of glass beads per num square feet of line ex .
num linear feet of four num inch stripe and num linear feet of six num inch stripe .
num filler the filler shall be a white calcium carbonate or equivalent filler with a compressive strength of at least num pounds per square inch .
num titanium dioxide titanium dioxide shall conform to the requirements of astm d num for type ii num percent .
num yellow pigment the yellow pigment shall be heat resistant and be lead and heavy metal free .
the type of yellow pigment shall be at the option of the manufacturer provided that the material conforms to all color requirements in a stable and durable fashion as specified herein .

num equipment section num pavement markings page num place the traffic paint and beads on the pavement using a spray type selfpropelled pavement marking machine .
the department will allow placing temporary striping during construction with other equipment designed for application of paint or beads .
use a machine capable of applying clearly defined four num inch lines .
use a machine equipped with a mechanical device capable of placing a broken reflectorized centerline with a ten num ft painted segment and a num ft gap .
use a machine with an airoperated glass bead dropin dispenser controlled by the spray gun mechanism .
use a dispenser capable of placing the glass spheres into the paint line as the paint is applied to the pavement to provide marking and delineation as specified .
num measurement devices provide measurement of the volume of paint and beads in the tanks by one num of the following measurement methods num .
strap measurement num .
external tank marks indicating a volume equivalent to the tolerances shown in section num tolerance requirements for placing paint and beads or num .
a calibrated rod marked with the equivalent volumes .
provide certification for the volumes of the paint and bead tanks .

strap the tanks before beginning striping operations and again after striping one num mile .
if approved by the project manager and if the striping machine is equipped with airatomized spray units and paint and bead gauges the contractor may determine the paint and bead volumes using these gauges .
also measure the volumes at the start and end of each days operations .
